Ep6_SKRaBZb9dxSbfybJaA.text: After watching an Indie at the Film Bar, we wanted to find a place to pause for awhile and, lo and behold, Moira Sushi.  Mind you, it was past 9 PM on a Tuesday night.  And I thought it was so awesome that it was still open for those of us who despise going home right after seeing a movie.  The place is so chic, great ambiance, food and service.  It was kinda dead given it was a week day night, but still happening in a quiet sort of way. We ordered various sorts of mouth flavoring bites. Everything was MWAH! Pick something, anything.  You really can't go wrong! It's a good thing I was accompanied by sushi savvy people.

4iRFRea8SNbdaZ6nqaRDFw.text: Props for having the hippest late night sushi reverse happy hour open til 2am. After a show at the US Airways Center, walk down the road and have some quality sushi with some quality staff, jamming to quality old school pop music.  This place has plenty of attitude but also food to prove that they deserve to have more attitude.  Ask for Lisa when you are here.  She is great.  I promise to take piix next time, but, what you need to know is that thee hot saki is really good for being a house serving. They also keep you hydrated and wanting more and more fish.  Their seaweed salad is very good.  I had the volcano roll which was not very hot but you can ask for more heat.  The overall menu is satisfying.   I will be back.  A little earlier next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This one has eel .
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Try seaweed wrapped in Salmon with avocado . Lit up and ready to be devoured!
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Volcano eaten

YXG0safYBwgUqLwMSHdT-Q.text: Looks very nice outside and setting is fair inside. Menu is on the expensive side for sushi menu but doable. When getting the Dragon Roll forget the flame effect the portion size was very lack luster. It had a slice of eel on top and only crab inside, I was disappointed in the texture and flavor choice. The worst Dragon Roll in all of Arizona or the US. I had another roll once again another roll with crab with horrible flavor and texture they need to remove these rolls from their menu or their imitation crab altogether. My wife got hand rolls, so small and cheap not worth the sticker price. Worst sushi place in Phoenix and worst food joint ever in my 15 years passing through Phoenix. Don't go.

0ZcJccQSgExPQDUi3wPLdw.text: Half the time the food is good, the other half it's just 'ight. Our patient and friendly server readily answered all our questions and was very flexible about adding or removing items from our order, as we couldn't decide what to get. Landed on: poke salad, seaweed salad, a couple fried rolls, shishito peppers, chicken curry, and some cold rolls. As I mentioned, half the order was delicious like the peppers, poke salad, and cold rolls, and the other half was not 100% (dry curry, for example). Though this resto is not perfect, it hits the sushi spot when the craving strikes

Qa9zmwefXWE8qy417-Kzfg.text: Even if you're turned off by trendy sushi bars, Moira is worth a try. The menu is quite large and diverse, with some choices that are generally hit or miss.   The Geisha roll looked promising (lotus root? yum!), but I was so overwhelmed by the cream cheese I couldn't taste what looked to be a promising experience.  The Sakura roll really hit the spot. I have a weakness for unagi, and it did well with the snow crab and maguro. Also, the eel sauce had a nice kick to it, and is now my favorite. Some argue these rolls cost just a tad too much, but once you remember the quality of ingredients going in to every bite, I'd say it's just right.  But this sushi alone is far from mindblowing. If the review ended here, it would be a 3.5 rounded down to a solid 3 stars. Moira goes the extra mile by providing an exotic selection of cocktails and beers. There are a dozen or so lagers and stouts from the far east. I ordered the Singha Thai lager, and my comrades had some pretty interesting stouts from Japan. Most sushi bars will only carry Kirin Ichiban, Sapporo, and maybe Tsingtao, so the diversity is welcome. Also, the cocktails are worth a try. The list seemed to have run of the mill drinks, with a few exotic looking options. I can only compare it to Kabuki's drink menu, only with what I assume to be higher quality.  I'll be back for the happy hour, or to be more specific, the REVERSE Happy Hour featured here on Friday nights. It looks very promising, and I hope this place keeps living up to my four star endorsement.

fBH1WnAiWewVxXJavMFc3Q.text: Yummy! My first time here and this place was incredible. Will definitely come back although the ceiling light was directly hitting our face - well just move seats next time lol!

S0Pv6YAofWq33fJpW_FVNg.text: Really nice happy hour. Sadly, poorly attended/known at this point. So do your part, Yelpers, give them a chance!  Nice service, comfortable dark atmosphere, sake bombers and rolls and good times?  What's not to like?  Hang in there, Moira, let's rally!

RlT0dNfAmYf6gzElZ9Wcjg.text: Sit at the bar if you can and tip your guys well; the sushi is amazing and the guys at the bar really know how to multi-task. The servers are horrible, avoid if you can.

FPpf4s6qbtYQWsYg8F-4Mw.text: Went here last night for a quick sushi night after work, saw the good yelp reviews but honestly sushi rolls are plan and dry with no flavor! Good looking restaurant inside but that's all the good it had. Try at your own risk

nQZHvi_AGSLsm5znlalfcw.text: Great meal but the waiter was so rude and unprofessional that I have to mark the score down.  He was hitting on my date the entire evening - granted he knew get from the tanning booth that he used to work at - but professionalism carries an establishment because good sushi is finally evolving in the area.  It was also my second time getting the fried noodle basket with shrimp - vastly different experience than the first time. It was not good - the shrimp tasted like dirt as if it wasn't washed.  Great sushi though. However, given the experience with waiter I will not repeat

PcKn1zB67SbANxr7CAgNJg.text: Terrible service. Been here for 45 minutes and still waiting for part of our order. Orders for each person at table came out wrong. Only 5 people in the whole place and they can't keep up. No refills on any beverages but water that tastes like dirt. Not going back here.

mkH7-CDYPTjXNJQnKnQwNA.text: Amazing fresh sushi.  Unique rolls.  My favorite was the Sun Devil. Great service from Ethan, our waiter.  He made us feel really special.  Highly recommend!!!!

XUsvR-BsGW1ukDUhTPOPRA.text: We went there for the Friday Happy Hour and they had a DJ . I will state that I'm a huge music fan and do have a penchant for Hip Hop (especially the nineties era) and DJ JSong (in-house DJ) did not disappoint. He primarily played Bay Area and West Coast Songs that are all must plays in my Ipod.   Can't say much about the food (As I only had a bit of Sake), but it is a good atmosphere during Happy Hour with great tunes!!!

vV1l6V-h3454eq_AaNMNCQ.text: Went to Moira last night to celebrate my girlfriend's first week at her new job and this was also to be my first time trying sushi. While I was delightfully surprised with the food (I can hardly believe I enjoyed sushi), our server was overbearing, literally standing over us while we ate, continuing conversation well past the acceptable level of small talk expected and even went to get his phone to unsolicitedly show us pictures he had taken since we had mentioned a mutual interest of photography in passing. While the conversation was "good", I did not come out to talk with the waiter while we ate and doing so made my girlfriend extremely uncomfortable. I'm a nice person and have a hard time with confrontation in situations like this, so maybe it's partially my own fault for entertaining the conversation and not saying something in the moment, but I still feel no one should be made to feel like they have to ask for privacy when they are paying customers out on the town with their significant other. This really should be common sense for wait staff and I wonder why management would allow their employees to attend to one table for over an hour while they ate without saying something about it. Something seems fishy, and it's not the sushi.

XIKSZfAapnKGKiR4VOM2yA.text: Been here many times over the past few months since it's close to the hotel I stay in when in Phoenix--and these last two months I have been just about living in that hotel!  I do like the atmosphere of the place.  It's dark, relaxing, and tucked far enough away off the beaten path that there's hardly any foot traffic going by outside.  If I go mid-week which is usually the case, I can find a corner table, open my laptop, and catch up on my email as I linger over dinner for an hour+.  Since they are not too busy when I go I don't feel bad about hogging a table.  The mussels are very good but there are only four to a serving for (I think) $8 (online menu does not show prices).  If you really like mussels go up the street to The District Restaurant in the Sheraton where you can get a seemingly endless bucket of mussels for $12.  I mean seriously, we're not talking lobster here.  These are mussels--the cockroaches of shellfish that cut up your feet at low-tide.  $8 for four of them is too much.  The roils are good, the sashimi is good, the waiters and waitresses are all very nice.  I will keep coming back but from now on I do my mussels elsewhere.

m4k4CyXfry0213Z3AoOH4w.text: Unreasonably priced and not impressive tasting AT ALL. It cost us over $50 for two not-starving young woman with no drinks ordered. Also the weird metal chairs are extremely uncomfortable.

E4MPJm8VfU_x_ps0loOYAA.text: My roomate and I have been here twice and it is delicious, very fresh for being in the desert! We have had Megan and Luis who are both amazing servers, attentive, sweet and extremely friendly. As for Linda who is one of the owners, is rude, degrading to her staff in front of customers and all around seems like a c*nt!!! If I return again and experience she is the same way I will not be returning to give their business my money and support such HORRIBLE behavior, it is inexcusable and not deserved by her very hard working staff!

U9UnOlskd_8afY6Fv1BA0Q.text: Consistently good, my second favorite sushi place in the valley.  I like the music they play, but it's often so loud that we have to pretty much shout to hear each other.  Turn it down to 9 instead of 11, please and thank you.

XEgvkKbmF1rHMwsmxy02Lg.text: We entered the restaurant and were immediately greeted by staff. One of the waitresses asked if we wanted a table or to eat at the bar. We initially said table, but she was going to have to set it up before she sat us so we said bar. She then proceeded to have a conversation with her coworker. After a few minutes of standing there and watching this conversation continue another waitress stepped in to seat us. Unfortunately, the waitress having the conversation continued to be our waitress for the rest of the night. The food was good. The gentleman next to us also received a very small pour of wine and after 2 requests still did not receive ice water. He informed us he had been here a couple of times and the service was not good. It took awhile to receive my drink when there was only 1 other table seated aside from the gentleman next to us. It took awhile to have someone explain how to order food. The lady who actually seated us was amazing and every now and then checked in on us even though we clearly weren't her table. It took even longer for the check. Overall, if you don't mind the service it's a decent place to go for sushi.

hIb28r_W9xu-2xS_fE0kNQ.text: I've been here a few times now over the years. I have to say, it's good, just not great. I wouldn't exactly recommend it either. The service is ok, the sushi is average. I hate to knock it, I just know there is better spots around with a little more offerings. The menu is a tad short and a bit confusing at first, and having to request a sushi order paper so I can write my choices down is something I'm not use to. I may be back for some sake down the road but I'm aware of my expectations and those are so-so. I would like to say that it is a great sushi spot on a Friday and Saturday night when you know the other places will be packed. It's location away from the prime downtown intersections is in my opinion, the main appeal to me.

cSVZ7nZ8kpbSQzzXANXJVw.text: Great for happy hour, an reverse happy hour.  Sushi is top notch, they have a bunch of custom rolls that are great. Great atmosphere, real urban downtown feel.

y1Qqg8AbbxMaDZ8_ms0b7A.text: First of all, the service was awful. they had empty tables and still kept you waiting a while. the udon soup was ultra-salty and when i told the waitress  she didn't apologize and said "it usually is salty, what do you want me to do with it?"  WHAT?  the mango sauce for the fried tofu didn't taste like mango at all.  It was just sugar-laden soy sauce.  The saving grace was the red curry with rice - yum!  The music was an awful NOISE, and the service so slow.  I'll never go back.  it's the second restaurant I went to in downtown phoenix that was just AWFUL!

NXW3StRcJLCpNEnK2f1G4w.text: Best calamari in town, and awesome service. Tokyo glow is a great drink, super refreshing.

hOpspWwdMz6S7MtWjsRWBw.text: I love this place! I have been to this establishment many times to eat and it keeps getting better. I totally know why this place was on the top 10 downtown dining review from Howard Steffel. On my last visit to Moira I had the Hamachi Cheek which was phenomenal. The head chef made me a cucumber roll that had everyone at my table wanting to to try it and they couldn't say enough about how flavorful the roll was. I also had the rainbow roll and the caterpillar roll which was a big success with my seven year old niece who is new to the sushi world also, I would like to add that both rolls were great. Moira also offers great bottled beverages my niece loved the japanese soda and I'm a big fan of the bottled teas they offer.  sexy, and fresh....Im completely loving Moira's decor its totally modern. and I can't help but address some complaning yelpers  If you want quality.... well, then you have to pay for quality:-) Unless, you go to happy hour then you get the deals. Moira's rolls are made with the freshest ingredients you can often run into the main chef picking up items from the locally grown markets in phoenix before and during his lunch hour to make sure he has the best product for his customers.   Also, the Harry Bertoia's Wire Chairs you guys talk so much of...I happen to love the art but  the word is they are redesigning a new pad for the bottom of the seat.  So all of you people that are rocking the caucausian long board and don't have enough cushion for the pushin are in luck. I just hope it doesn't ruin the look of moira's cool chairs.   With all that said I love moira and the great sushi chefs they always have me leaving with a smile:-)

mIh8u1EM-fST1dqJYBQuEQ.text: A friend and I finally decided to go on and explore Moira after our two favorite spots, to chill at and have a couple of drinks, were completely full.  As we enter we were promptly greeted by our hostess and shown our seats but keep in mind, the place was about a quarter of the way full on a Saturday.    The ambiance of this the place is very cool and dark, kinda like The Roosevelt, with bar standing out with the bluish neon lights that were displaying the sharp angles and the reflective metals that weren't noticeable at first.  Our waitress was engaging and always at our attention.  She informed us that this spot is the neighborhood's little secret and mostly filled with locals.  She looked like a cut out from comic con and I know that could be a little stereotypical but I believe that it probably added to Moira's identity.  I wasn't sure what I wanted to drink so our waitress recommended the Hitachino Nest White Ale which was a great choice.  We order the Udon noodle soup and Vegas sushi.  The Udon noodle soup was good with Low Mein noodles and beefy broth but I believe that this bowl is reserved for vegetarians.  Now the Vegas sushi rolls, were just utterly amazing!  Served with sides of Wasabi and some shavings that have a citrusy taste and with that combination my tongue has been resurrected.  I couldn't believe that my tongue could experience such a degree of exhilaration.   I highly recommend Moira.  This place is adorable and the food is great with a decent price range compare with its local hotspot neighbors.  I can't believe that I was always passing by Moira without knowing what a jewel I had in my own neighborhood.  Moira will definitely be put in my weekly rotation of hangouts that I go to, see you there...  Note, this was my first time eating sushi and for me this is the standard.

E2_FFVrwWZGcR7S5_EgYiA.text: My fiancee and I found this place on-line when we were looking fot sushi in the Central Phoenix area. Neither of us had heard of it but we decided to give it a go. We got there around 8:30 and the place was kindof empty so we were a little nervous. We walked in and were seated at a table by the window. We were seated with dinner menus but not a sushi menu. Ther server said they only give those out at the sushi bar. I thought that was a little wierd but the server was nice and the decor was hip and modern (it was metrosexual according to my fiancee) so we went with it.   We ordered lots and lots of sushi - ika salad, hamachi sashimi ($9), spicy tuna roll ($7), shrimp tempura roll ($7), and the sunshine roll ($11) (spicy salmon with lemon on top). We could not complain about anything! It was all very very good. It tasted fresh, yummy, and hit the spot. The total bill was $47.00 which sounded about right considering how much food we ordered!   We liked the decor, the service, and the food. I noticed they had a lunch menu so I will be taking my co-workers back with me next time!

kxEtJBFSwCmU6W-wkG7Hpg.text: In town for business and discovered this little gem of a sushi place downtown. Great sushi, and Tony, the owner prepared some really great dishes for us! They could have used at least one more wait staff person last night as our server was overworked, although remained very friendly! I would definitely go back next time I am here, which will be next month!

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RFs1xQ04LSJPe2FT2B3K8A.text: I had the privilege of dinning at Moira Sushi in central Phoenix on my birthday thanks to my friend Q. I must admit that I seldom venture outside of my norm due to distance, but this was well worth the drive. Everyone from our party really enjoyed themselves along with the Sake Bombers and the food.   Our waitress was prompt and very friendly. The setting was fantastic I really liked the layout. Moira is definitely a place I will return to. Thanks for making that night a great one Linda & Q!  For some reason I didn't snap any pictures of the food, but the next time I promise I will.

sRMhmWzG3MgSw78UBAYk8A.text: I loved this place, awesome atmosphere and the service was great. The sushi was fresh and they had a good selection.

PRpT8pfHDewudrpJ2x4kuA.text: I went to this place last week with a friend and I was really impressed, I was skeptical based on the other yelp posts that it was going to be a waste of time and money, however after arriving the waiter was very polite and gave great suggestions for first time customers. One of our favorites was The Caterpillar which is not only cute but tasty. This place is not high end so don't feel you have to go black tie because to be honest the other guests were in shorts and flip flops. The bar is nice and long so there are many seats available if you prefer to sit there. The decor is just right for the location; it's not over the top but has a nice flair. The lighting to me was perfect as well as the restrooms being very clean. The sushi is priced just right for what you pay for. The only downside we found was the drinks are overpriced for this place, like we said there "this is not Weho we are not paying $10 for a drop of vodka!" Other than that I would recommend for other's to check it out, it's not the best, but it's good for what you receive.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the catapillar

DvwDM06ON_7U46uKuiGUHA.text: Finally a decent sushi spot downtown with a good vibe! Typical hipsters on staff, but friendly enough! Had some really interesting rolls here.... one even had beef on top of it! Try to catch them during happy hour if you can, as 3 rolls and 2 drinks will set you back about 50 bones during non happy hour times!

jXC3MEjMCghRIy1ZykKVCQ.text: Really disappointed with this place. My friends had a birthday gathering here and the manager was so rude. She was not accommodating at all even though we brought them a lot of business that night. She walked around telling people where they could or couldnt stand, she tried to even ask our friends to leave who  were still eating. When we asked if she was the manager, she threatened to call the police on us. I would not go back there.  It's too bad though because the food was pretty good.

jEe-8tNrNakjZC6jgz9msg.text: Four stars for the sushi, with an extra star for the location.  Moira is on the ground floor of a condo development in downtown Phoenix, easily walkable from other restaurants such as Pasta Bar and Roosevelt, and that itself is saying a lot.  A modern sushi place located in a condo building in downtown Phoenix speaks a great deal to the development of downtown, and I give kudos and an extra star to the owners of Moira for opening where they did.  That all said, Moira is an excellent on the sushi point too.  I had a Philly roll that had just the right combination of salmon and cream cheese (not too much cream cheese), a caterpillar roll with a great balance of color and flavor (and decorated, cutely, as a caterpillar) and a couple of nigiri with a very flavorful yellowtail and mackerel with an interesting sauce that complimented the fish.    I am hoping that this will soon transform from a place that you go to because you are downtown to a place people will go downtown for.  And it may - because it is quite good.  Well worth seeking out.

iFA_KYTsITeGn8_ghIS8Fw.text: Extremely courteous service.  Waiter made phenomenal recommendations and the sushi was very fresh.  Highly recommended.

T85vzPDXibOZ_p0aDbAVSw.text: "Meh, I've experienced better" fits this place to a T.  On the bright side, it was cheap.  Happy hour specials are inexpensive, and you can do dinner and drinks for four for $60 or so.  The decor is warm, inviting and open, and it's exactly what downtown needed--a hip sushi place.  The staff's been really friendly on my two visits there.  That being said, the fish is decent and the rolls are mediocre-to-terrible.  I've gone twice needing a sushi fix and left not feeling satisfied.  And I've tried about half the rolls on the menu--from the uncomplicated California to the Vegas and Spider to a Volcano and some other stuff.  Most rolls were warm instead of the crisp cool I'm used to, and the flavors weren't distinctive.  I expect something in every sushi roll to give that roll a "pop" and it just doesn't happen at Moira--you feel like you're eating a warm Cuisinart mush-roll.  All four people at my table reached the same conclusion independently, and it wasn't groupthink, I swear.  I know this is a harsh review, but I'd like the see the place succeed.  For that to happen, they're going to have to either take more care with their ingredients and presentation or hire someone who REALLY knows their stuff.  I think I'll wait a few months for them to get it together before going back--rather not drive out of downtown for sushi but going to have to if I want my sushi itch properly scratched.

95FGQxnEWT_cgm74EG9yTA.text: 2 visits and both times a really good dinner. the food is really good. i don't eat fish, it's a personal belief. but i enjoy the hot kitchen here.   the yaki soba is by the my favorite thing. i've ordered it with Steak and with Tofu and both times it was awesome. plus its like a 2 minute walk from my apartment. i'm surprised i don't eat here more. i promise next time to explore the menu more.

yIO48qhP3Vr4eVC7XDu7QA.text: I'm not sure why it took so long to get here, but I'm glad we came.  I'll begin with my drink which was excellent.  I had the Tokyo Glow.....delish.  We had the tuna appetizer which was also quite good.  For dinner I had the Fuji roll, which was excellent.  I haven't had this roll before, and it was a perfect blend of fish and veggies all in one roll.  My gf's drink and roll were just okay, hence the 4 stars.  I was a bit surprised to see that the restaurant was only half full on a Saturday night (although there was a storm, so maybe people stayed home)...all in all a good experience.  Not sure I'd make the drive to go back, but if I'm downtown, I would consider going there.

9lArZ8PdGenjgDv3D_RJwg.text: This place was mediocre at best. I went with my sister for lunch. The rolls were completely overpriced ($11 and $13), which wouldn't have bothered me so much if they were good. Bland doesn't even describe them. We got the Sakura and Geisha roll and for all the delicious goodness that was supposed to be in them, I was extremely disappointed at how crappy they were. I was totally in the mood for sushi too, which makes it suck even more! They were a nice size, which is why I gave this place the 2 stars. At least I wasn't starving, I was just lacking good sushi when I walked out. And the service there is almost as bland as the food is. And I agree with someone who said it in another review...those seats are HORRIBLE!! Maybe it's a better nighttime spot? Who knows, I won't be going back.

-haCDgvaorGoxL9oaYODdg.text: We accidentally went to this place, but I thought it meant to be. The interior was nice and modern.  Fish were fresh. Some of their sushi rolls were innovative!  We'll definitely go back, again.  Very soon.

4exULiFzmx5395SuHWhKFA.text: I wish i could tell you how the food taste but we didnt get that far... Me and a friend decide to check this place out. We get seated at the same time another couple gets seated, they got drinks apps and ordered dinner and we never got approached. The place was not busy and everyone in the restaurant was sat in one corner of the restaurant. The two servers walked by us multiple times never once did we get greeted nor did we ever get to order drinks or anything at all. It was like we were intentionally being ignored. About 20 mins went by and still no one has came to speak to us so we decided to leave... One of the servers happened to be by the door when we were walking out and had the audacity to tell us to have a nice night... Wow that was te first time a server spoke to us is when we were on the way out... Wtf horrible non experience

I found a bone in my salmon, the tuna was smelly, the miso was not good (and they called it Chinese?) and the hostess was rude from entry. When we let her know how bad the food was, she rolled her eyes and said she would call the manager to see if it they could anything to resolve the issue, passing the blame and not taking ownership. 6sly8u6iC3S2H_a_j8qaAQ.text: I didn't love it...I think the appeal is that from Mon-Thursday happy hour is going until 11pm and the price is pretty good...but the food isn't that great.  I'd rather pay a little more for better Japanese food.  Their japanese fried chicken (karaage) was one of the least favorite of the night. I think if you order the simpler rolls, it would be better. 3 stars is generous but I think the happy hour deserves a little credit.

03UgU4bZKM_0cRQjJB3MJw.text: Although it didn't have many stars, I went in hoping it would be good. But no, I didn't like this place. The food was mediocre and overpriced. The appetizer was 4 thin slices of yellowtail. The roll I got was meh. Even the hot tea wasn't priced right at 5 bucks.

NnA2SQlgSTt1jWD62iumOg.text: Amazing!! Simply amazing. The food is incredible. It's unique and tastes amazing. Why it only 3.5 starts on Yelp is a mystery to me and everyone else I know who has tried this place.  We came here on first Friday and it wasn't packed. They seated us right away and the servers were very sweet and funny. Lovely atmosphere. I will definitely be coming here again!!

L9AXUMsxojsSf8CFAbf3eQ.text: Absolute favorite place for take out downtown. Food is packaged perfectly and comes out great every time. Their sushi is great but I really love all of their other options. They updated their menu since the last time I came in and they're great additions. Also best food happy hour anywhere in phoenix for price and quality.

P3_16aeD7VzBqN1uHD66CQ.text: Always wanted to come here and glad we got a chance to go. They are very accommodating when we asked for the rolls to be cucumber wrapped for our Cali roll and crunch roll. Spicy lobster roll was really good but really spicy! Had the jalapeno crab cream cheese and fried tofu appetizer. Everything was really good. Our server was really nice and very attentive. Love the late happy hour menu. Would come back for sure!

98_8TmFrV2BWfoQ4hxFjSw.text: Where should I even begin!!!! The waitress with the blond hair was completely rude and not present .. we had to order through other people multiple times because she would take someone's order and start walking away before we even finished. She had an attitude every time she came to the table like she hated her job. If you don't enjoy working in customer service then QUIT . I love eating here because I live up the street but she was unbelievably horrible . And when the bill came, I told her to put part on the card and the rest cash and she looked at me and said "are you talking to me" with an attitude.. like YES who else would I be telling to charge partial payment on my card .. completely not present and doesn't seem to even want to work here. Worst customer service ! Me and my girlfriends were completely turned off

X7x5NT7vGS7gm1Ii1J4SJw.text: I rarely write reviews, but this was such a standout example of poor service fuckery, I felt compelled. I'm a bartender in the same district as this place at a highly-rated bar & restaurant, so I do know a few things about the service industry.   The hostess and two other servers didn't acknowledge myself and the individual with whom I arrived despite the three of them standing directly next to the host stand chatting.   The woman I assume was the hostess then returned to said stand, where she proceeded to shuffle papers around, stare at their dry-erase layout, and answer the phone. The other servers continued their conversation unbothered.   Not even a, "hello, someone will be right with you."   After approximately three to five minutes another woman approached and sat us at the bar.   Fast forward another ten minutes and we had not been greeted or received waters, so we left.   There were no less than 6 - 8 open tables, and we saw many servers just standing around peering over their sections from around corners, or chatting with each other.   Everyone warned me against eating here due to the lack of service in particular, but I like to make up my own mind.   In this case, the warnings were not exaggerated.   The number of open tables at 8pm during a first Friday should have been a giant red flag but, alas, I prefer to give places the benefit of the doubt.   Stay away unless you have plenty of time to kill and zero service expectations.

e-ArrTIXjo5hLDm7Bq3ulg.text: Cute little sushi spot with amazing food. We ordered the garlic edamame. I had the philly roll and the San Pandre? I believe that was what it was called. :D it was AMAZING! Docked one star because the food seemed to take forever. Especially for lunch and we were one of two tables. Probably the best sushi downtown tho!

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Philly roll
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. San pandre? I think...delicious
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic Edamame!

V_fJghe-zA6f-oVT0Jfi2g.text: Moira Sushi is fantastic! I used to live across the street when I was in college and a group of us would go for happy hour on a weekly basis. The sushi is affordable and the sake is delicious. They give you smaller cups for the beer, so you can actually enjoy multiple sake bombs with one order. If you go make sure to order the Dragon roll. It's not on the happy hour menu, but it's delicious. And the dragon breathes fire!  ;)

3BMRU-_PtvagIcK8dLJnNw.text: This place needs serious management help.  Terrible food and service.  Very salty and not quality sushi.  Very bad dining experience.

c1TVRM6It4x126svEn___A.text: yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum   the ambiance is super fresh. it feels like a Weeknd music video- dark, sleek, low neon lights.  we sat at the bar, really love watching those guys roll- always good spectacle   ill admit though- the service is spotty. idk what our waiter thought being a waiter meant. he would just like come up and nervously ask if we were okay (as if we were recovering from a traumatic surgery) but wouldn't clear any of the finished plates (we ordered like 7 different things). it felt like he was scared of human interaction   Alas, you will notice that i am still giving 4 stars and thats because this place is bomb banging slappin sauce fire flames  get the chicken wings. if you don't, your life may be miserable from this point on.  also, get the Tiger roll. this may be an item at other places. it was the first time i ever saw it tho. basically it was a crab mix roll with a coconut shrimp on top and sweet thai chile sauce. oh man. what a Collision Course (shout out Jay-Z and Linkin Park) of flavors!!  also also the hamachi belly should be in your belly. and your belly will do this because of it.. :)

xWRPwM669N6deXmofiAHGQ.text: This restaurant never fails to please me. It's visually beautiful and the sushi is beyond delicious. It's probably the only place I'll really miss when I leave Phoenix.

mVFpiF0RA8rH96sJ940GvQ.text: Love the atmosphere and sushi selection. We got the sunshine and sun devil rolls and both had great taste. We also got the sushi nagiri and gyoza which weren't that great. The service was prompt and friendly. Definitely will be back if we are downtown!

i_B-QbRoD56JDYctGf7gdg.text: The food is great and that's the only reason we keep coming back but last night might have been our last time.   There hasn't been a time where I come to Moira and had good service at all. Takes 10+ minutes to get just waters on the table every time. Food doesn't take long once we order, but last night we canceled the chicken wings we ordered for miso soup, then the waiter brings out some gyoza I didn't order and then continues to argue with me that I did order it. Told him to bring out the menu so I can show him what I ordered...never did. Ended up not even getting my volcano roll.   He came by to see how we were doing and didn't even pick up several empty plates on our table and the restaurant wasn't even busy it was 10pm at night during their happy hour.   When we got a 10 dollar check and it was wrong but we thought they discounted it because the service was so bad. We brought it up and nope! Brought out our real check with all the things we didn't even get on our table.   The manager didn't even come to us and apologize at all she just said "is that them" and gave us the updated check.   Don't think we will be coming back. Good luck.

l-gFaQucL2jyE-QA1lgR3A.text: Service was slow.. Sushi was OK nothing great. Sashimi was so thin it tore when you picked it up. I would not go back!

28D5NfsFFd8ASpR-CgWw6A.text: This place never fails. Quite, quaint and delicious. Thursday happy hour is amazing. $7 saki and $5-6 sushi. Always my go to for great sushi and conversation

0O5XHxLV_sCj1JZwwWeujA.text: The Dragon roll I am amazing experience! Burns on fire! Quite and nice place. The service was a bit slower but everything else is pretty good. Eating there you feel that modern vibe and comfortable feeling. Happy hour has a lot of options. One of my favorite places in Downtown Phoenix.

l3xLGfM4VZKBJx3loxL-8w.text: Horrible service tonight if I could I would give no stars . Food wasn't very good either I would say 2 stars for the food .

3r-MwWDAvOus5AJD6Mso5g.text: What kind of sushi place serves you an hour after the food is ordered? and without any explanation? Our server was not the best and brought 2x orders of what we ordered. Sushi here is mediocre at its best taste-wise and definitely pleasing to your eyes.

Wlz381nuAEHuR8RQGgc1KQ.text: Love the food here however, the service is just awful.  I consider myself a patient person but last night - not busy at all and my husband had to up and ask for our check.  After waiting and waiting I finally got up and had a word with our waiter. I'm hoping the management will improve on the wait staff.

AbwsKvySpo8h8EYqAElpLA.text: Moira isn't the best sushi I've ever had, but for Phoenix and my neighborhood and the pricepoint (as long as we don't order alcoholic beverages) is doable when we get a sushi craving.   The happy hour is a great benefit if you can get away from work before it ends.    Their spicy rolls are definitely spicy, and have some great kick to them. It hits the spot without breaking the bank and we'll take it.

I8RmfmFe1jWDf5_X3Gbnxg.text: This is a destination worthy place. If I lived in the immediate area, I would be a frequent regular. Really good quality sushi, coupled with a very comfortable and visually pleasing venue. Looking forward to my next visit.

buwYYEtlREaL_vxCviASRA.text: I went here with a couple of friends at about 10:30 the other night for their reverse happy hour.  $5 sushi?  Yes, please.  I got the vegetarian rolls and they were delicious.  I have no complaints about the food or the service, and I love things downtown that are open late, especially in the summer.  My reservation is that I was not a fan of the atmosphere.  I would totally go here all the time for a tasty post-show/movie/date meal for the cost of Filiberto's if it weren't for the douchey vibe this place has.  Dark, with loud, bad music and stupid glowy lights.  It's not a good place if you want to actually have a conversation or see the people you're with.  I felt kind of embarassed to be there.  This isn't Scottsdale.  Turn on the lights and turn down (off?) the crappy dance music, please.

fS1c8j386L2kQhtRnwxjiQ.text: I went to this place for lunch and I wasn't really impressed with the lunch specials they had to offer, the the sushi was okay. The tables were really close together and the chairs were kind of uncomfortable (some seemed broken).   I went back for happy hour one day and was a little bit more impressed. They have hot saki for $2 and a seaweed salad for $3 (decent size too). The have multiple rolls that were prices at $5 and $6 that were very good. I wish they had these happy hour specials during lunch because that would get me going back there multiple times.

aDv7guFKz3iV9Wvb7vCSrA.text: Hidden Gem.  And this gem shines bright (literally, it's got tons of fancy blue light oozing out through the doors and windows).  Good evening, Downtown Phoenix, it's past 10pm and there's still a place to go.  The reverse happy hour here (starts at 10:30pm Fridays, not sure about other nights) brings me back.  $7 sake bombs, where being loud and making a mess is never a problem.  Shannon (possibly the best waitress anywhere) will probably just come be a loud mess with you.  There's been a DJ in the kitchen every time I've been by, and the music is perfect for a Friday night transition between bars.  Oh yeah, the food's good too.

PFzctrqY6gKtgOQE8DG6XQ.text: Great sushi and better service. Never too busy and best sushi in downtown. Nice, small vodka bar feel. Tables are too close to each other and when having a private conversation it becomes a little uncomfortable.

mrAlmBkSWfABiMxRE7DluA.text: Literally  just leaving and extremely  disappointed! I've been going to this restaurant for about two years now and I noticed the quality was decreasing.  Today's  experience  put a stamp on it. We got to the restaurant  at 8:55 to order from the happy hour menu and throughout our meal the waiter addressed us and said well unfortunately  since you came at 8:55pm we can't honor the 9:30 happy hour. ... FIRST OFF THE HAPPY HOUR IS AT 9!!!!! they obviously need to review THEIR  OWN MENU and also their website!!!!!! long story short I was so surprised  because we have been going here for years! When we got the bill IT WAS ALL WRONG. I grabbed the happy hour menu to check the prices and everything was off $2-$3. So when I told our server he apologized, took our check and came back and said.. "you guys were 5 minutes short of happy hour "..... I could NOT BELIEVE IT.  What ever happened to customer service,  or should I say LOYAL customer service?.. I will NEVER  go back. THEY JUST LOST  LONG TERM CUSTOMERS .

s0m62uFQ4AM4I_PV5_Ygew.text: First time visiting here with a big group of co-workers, and I had a great time.  I was worried the tiny place wouldn't be able to accommodate a group of ten, but with no reservations, they were able to seat us almost immediately.   The ambiance was nice, somewhat more modern than what I like, but it was warm and cozy, and I thought it would be a great place to come back to when the nights are cooler and they have their doors open.  The food and service, though, was fantastic! I wasn't sure exactly what to get, but our group decided to order a bunch of stuff and share it.  Thinking back we should have ordered more because it was so good and I wanted more, but everything was delicious.  We didn't order anything too crazy -- mostly we order different types of rolls -- but each one was superb!   And, although I didn't participate in the sake bomb drinking, my other co-workers did and they said the drinks were great. Oh, and we were having so much fun, we decided to bet a co-worker to eat a huge dollop of Wasabi.  He was a sushi newbie, and really had no idea about the potency of the condiment.  I kept telling him not to do it, but after only $25 being put in the pot and our kind waiter bringing him a drink, he downed it all.  He was hurting for awhile, but hey, he got $25 from it.  All in all, Moira is a neat little gem of a sushi place downtown, and I'll definitely be coming back again for some yummy dishes and sake!

7jmxK4ANn_DkJrcVSVGWDw.text: Happy Hour Prices are great! The food - NOT so great Every single roll dish was covered with sauce.   I was let down because everyone hyped it up. This sushi restaurant is definitely mixed. Beware when you order the happy hour dishes you get the NOT so happy servings of fish (more rice and cucumbers). The server was friendly.   The food is definitely not good enough for round two.

lrdsNNRhvU6YNxUAgbQZng.text: So my best friend wanted to take me here and I was kind of skeptic about it.. she thinks RA sushi is good and if you think RA is good, well I just feel bad for you...and your life (but not my best friends, love youuu). Anyways, upon entering Moira, I liked the decor, specifically the Buddha statue that is on the bar counter (right? Can't really remember haha). It took a bit of time for us to get our server, but in general, the service was a bit on the slow side. Except, our server was very friendly and knowledgeable that it made up for it.   Now for the sushi, we decided not to get any appetizers just in case we didn't have enough room left. I feel like when it comes to sushi, you buy too many sushi rolls and after you ate an appetizer it's kind of like .. ahhhhhh dammit! I AM SO FULL ALREADY..must eat....   So we got the summer roll, tiger roll, and the the fuji roll. I would have to say, I wasn't impressed, but I definitely wouldn't say that this sushi is 'horrible' like some people are saying. For the summer roll, it was pretty good I must say, but the avocado wasn't too fresh..and the rolls were pretty small. But I would have it again if I came here...maybe..haha.  The tiger roll was my favorite one, it had coconut shrimp on top of the roll, it was huge though, I had a tough time eating it but definitely yummy. Only issue with that was the fact that the sauce was VERY overpowering, there was way too much of it on there..and I mean, the sauce was good..but not that good. Lastly, the fuji roll, definitely the least favorite of the three, not too much flavor, but not bad either, nor do I really have anything to say about it.   Oh but there is one thing I DEFINITELY recommend, I am a huge whiskey drinker only..but I decided to venture off and try the "Jaded". Oh my goodness, I seriously felt like I was drinking a raspberry type smoothie drink, but it wasn't a smoothie, it was just an awesome alcoholic puree that I would drink all the time..and sadly, I got a buzz off it, or more so it just made me really tired (only on 3 hours of sleep, alcohol is a slap in the face). Anyways, try it!  All in all, this is a place to try, but ... don't except to be WOW'd . I would consider this over Kona Grill or RA sushi any day of my life. I just think the rolls are a little over priced for what they offer and in some cases, the flavor is either missing or just way too much. But still,  I would come again.

RuvkMjvdC6E0xTsStnbPSA.text: 3/5 sauced out.  not bad for fish in a desert, once you get over that then it is worth a try. they have a good selection, though it is pretty pricey when it is not happy hour. i found it odd that the decor inside seemed anything but japanese though. pan-asian, if you will. i think that's also the take-away on the food--it is a lot of stuff put together to cover all the bases instead of one single thing that is quality at once. of all the ones we tried, the kamikaze was the best. the seaweed salad is also pretty good. cucumber gin drink was pretty strong, but not necessarily tasty.

FQ0lc2eJF5PmSfZjO73Odg.text: Okay so I have been to this place a few more times now. Usually on a first date. Usually a last date also. But I like the food. I have had a chance to try a lot of different things on the menu. And in reality its not that pricey. Especially when you don't have to pay. HA! okay so really I guess the only bad thing is the music is super duper loud on the weekends. But its not such a bad thing on a bad first date! Yay for sake!

AyEw8XDBzg2nZ5-1UFdueA.text: It's about time a sushi joint opened downtown.  I've been waiting for one forever, and yet it took me until last weekend to try it out.  We went with a big group (10) of us on a Saturday night.  We made reservations, which they even called to confirm earlier that day, and they had the table off in a separate area all ready for us.  Everything about this place was good.  Good ambience - felt young, hip, and fun.  Good drinks - I had sake bombers, but a couple of friends tried their cocktails and said they were good.  Good service - our waiter was awesome and worked really well with us.  And all agreed, good food.  I am a vegetarian, so I had the rainforest rolls.  They were so good, I had to get another order.  Someone made the comment that they're not cheap, but there are a lot of them, and that's right on track.  A couple of people got their dishes this well.  Everyone was happy, everything was great.   I am so glad that this place wasn't a disappointment, and I can't wait to go back.

y6xK74PyOnIiZMpUpzIfkQ.text: I found myself with a couple hours of free time, during my work day. So I wandered out for a little walk -- even though it was 106 out. After 20 minutes of strolling and sweating, I found myself in front of Moira Sushi, just opening for lunch, as if it were meant to be.   After some welcome air-conditioning and ice water, I ordered up some seaweed salad, hamachi, and just for kicks, the quail eggs. All were delicious, refreshing, served with a smile, and for reasonable prices.  It's so nice to know that a great lunch can be had so close to work. While my colleagues are grazing on their bland $5 footlongs, I'll be noshing on some tasty goodies from the sea!

rtModV7zsxYM1QqsJ591zQ.text: I've been here on many occasions and had delicious sushi concoctions. It's not the high-end kind of sushi I've tried in seaside towns/Singapore, but very, very good stuff! I mean, we are in the middle of the freaking desert here. The waitstaff-- one server in particular, wish I had her name-- is awesome. Chatty in the good kind of way, always make us feel welcomed and relaxed-- and alongside prompt service. They also have yummy cocktails, soup, and tea.... oh, also the chicken wings are scrumptious!

4JHykkyXZZ9o_g0zetT0tQ.text: This was an interesting experience. The sushi was very good especially for Phoenix where "fresh" fish is extremely hard to come by. The atmosphere and decor is great but I went there for lunch on a weekday and the time it took to get the food left something to be desired to get back to work on time. In addition it is July in Phoenix but they had the door propped open when its well over 100, huh?  The edamame was good but could use more salt throughout rather than just a sprinkle on top and of course it is hard to mess up edamame.  The tempura vegetables were battered well and the sauce had just the right hint of spice which was amazing. However, the vegetables that were used were ehhh and they were cooked in clumps together so you couldn't pick the veggies you really like without getting a mouth full of veggies you can do without. Now for the sushi. The spicy tuna roll was oh so good!  Just based on the sushi alone, I will go to Moira again and I recommend it to those looking for well done seemingly fresh sushi  but not when I have a time constraint like lunch on a weekday.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dNyPwhhiQGNxpk6hg698dw.text: I wanted to like this place, but I just couldn't. The food wasn't good: I applaud their efforts at fusion, but the combinations just didn't work. The calamari ended up soggy; their spider roll was bland. A friend had the surf and turf roll, which tasted like someone wrapped bland steak around a bland ball of rice.   My server was also forgetful; I ordered a drink, which he didn't remember until the check arrived. He was friendly and talked to us a lot, but still.. he failed at his main job, which was to provide table service.   And lastly, I couldn't enjoy even being at the restaurant (even though i did appreciate the decor and general cool vibe) because the chairs HURT SO MUCH. I wore a skirt, and about 25 minutes into the meal, the back of my legs looked like I had a crossword puzzle imprinted. I felt like I was sitting on a wire spatula. Everyone else in my group also complained about how uncomfortable they were during dinner.   So I'm sorry, Moira, I really like your vibe and your location, and I love the building you're in, but I'm just not that into you.  At all.

9lRPN6bqSLmZRj_ENhUCdg.text: I happen to find this gem of a place on my way to a meeting downtown.  I thought "sushi sounds good" and opened up the  Yelp app on my phone and Moira popped up.  When walking into this place, you forget that you're in Phoenix.. I felt like I was in Los Angeles and one of their trendy spots.  We are there right as they open and are quickly seated.  The waiter takes our drink orders and since it's happy hour, we decide on some food and drinks.    I dont recall the name of the dish, but the waiter sells us on their special and damn was it good.  It was spicy, something.. that's all I remember.  This is what ya get for writing a review so late.   Being a new sushi lover of only six months, I try to taste all that I can and there wasnt a thing we tried that wasnt good.  Just a great place.    I did notice that everyone who came in were women and blonde.. was there a convention in town?  I look forward to my next venture at this restaurant.

bbVB6urFyb-wU_VnvRnCNA.text: First off you must consume enough sake and beer to warrant a visit to the restroom. That way you can pass through the sexy, cold, metal chains dangling in the hallway door. Reminded me of the beads I had in my bedroom in 5th grade. Yep. Beads. Don't judge. It was the 70s you know!? And the restrooms themselves were fabulous as well. But this isn't a site on reviewing johns so let's get to the good stuff.   Immediate greeting. Quick seating. And minutes later...lots of EATING! The gyoza was orgasmic. Thin, crunchy with shrimp and veggies! The mussel appetizer was good, not great, but creamy and hot. Reminds me of Taylor Lautner...muscles, creamy...well you get the picture. We dove into the sushi; tuna, yellowtail, freshwater eel...you know, the standards. All delicious...yellowtail being the best.   The rolls, though I don't remember any names were all very good. One in particular was made with soy paper? Is that right? Soy paper? It was a nice break from the seaweed. Soy paper?   We spent about $50 a person...worth every penny. The vibe inside on a Monday night was pretty happening I must say. Sexy lighting and great tables along the window. Our server, complete with a big poofy mohawk was fantastic! Wasn't crazy about the chairs. What? Did they recycle some shopping carts?  Moira! I want moira you!

O2PqEfsjE5uCObNX9Cwb4Q.text: This place has great food and a good atmosphere. I have need had a bad roll here and always receive great service. The guys up front know how to do their job well! They usually have some good happy hour specials throughout the week.

qTm9KmzpDSUka4c7PzA-pQ.text: Wow... I haven't been to this place in a year.  There's a reason.  When Moira first opened, I waited a few weeks then went down there to check it out.  The sushi wasn't bad.  It was actually okay.   The reason I think it was even okay was because, like many others... I WANT to like it.  I've lived downtown for 15+ years and we're starving for an outstanding sushi spot... okay... even a "decent" sushi spot.  It didn't happen with Moira.  The first few times I went there... the food wasn't too shabby... but then... OOPS... not so good.  I've now gone there a couple of times and received FOUL sushi.  I'm not joking.  The icing on the cake was the last time my bf and I went there and the tuna sashimi was served to us in a VERY LARGE portion.  We were both excited... at first.  Then quickly realized that the fish was definitely past its expiration.  UGH... the smell was SO BAD.  When we alerted the server of this they told us that they'd see if they could take it off the bill.  Uh... we were NOT about to pay for this foul smelling tuna.  I mean who in their right mind would eat this?  In the end, they agreed to not have us pay for that dish.  What I thought was pretty screwed up was that they served this to us thinking that we were idiots and some stinky tuna would just fly under the radar.  NOPE!  Btw, the above experience isn't the only one.  I had a previously bad experience on NYE 2 years ago... and should have not gone back... but I chalked it up as one bad incident and thought I'd be open minded, since I really wanted to like it.  The only thing I could say positively about the place was that the sake menu was pretty good.  But to be honest with you... great sake is only a few steps away at Sens... along with some really tasty eats.  I truly want to have a great sushi place downtown here... why can't we get it?  I'm willing to pay a good price for exceptional food.  When will that exceptional sushi spot come to downtown PHOENIX?!

fkCq_UHsmhVy0-cKVC2XgA.text: Moira  updated their menu and took off those frozen potstickers that I mentioned in my earlier review.  Service was terrific and their new offerings were delicious.  They have a roll topped with a coconut shrimp that is very tasty.  Also enjoyed the $5 bombers that were on special for Halloween.

NvW22LplpfmunCAWpUoOHw.text: One of the best Sushi I've ever had in Phoenix great friendly staff and knowledgeable asked for recommendations and took it all I had to say was WOW! I would recommend it to anyone awesome time there and great atmosphere!

cNfECTBw5btERJ6t2HYSOQ.text: Wow,  seriously Moira? I've never had a worse experience just WALKING INTO a restaurant. Your manager, Brandon, closes the kitchen at 10 although your website says "open til 11". THEN...  Oh yes,  then he makes threatening remarks to my fiance for asking "what kind of restaurant closes their kitchen an hour before closing time?" and justifies them by saying he works in a law firm during the day and can get away with it.  Unbelievable. I've lived down the street for 6 years and had never gone to your restaurant due to the reviews I'd heard from friends about the additude of your staff. I wouldn't have gone at all if not for my fiance wanting to so bad. I guess that makes two more on the list of people who won't ever be coming back.

ebUsvtsbf4wAXBeVrR6Dvg.text: WOW to the Saturday night DJ he rocked & even did some old school scratching which I love btw. The hubs & I saddled up to the sushi bar & were welcomed by a nice wait staff. The other patrons were nice too. They even said hello neighbor when we were seated which I thought was friendly. The ambiance & happy hour drink specials are great. The sushi roll we tired was small for the moolah $15 & not great. Good mind you but not great. We'll be back for the DJ, happy hour specials, good service & ambiance. We'll try some of the hot dishes next time. Stay tuned.

ts2wcLR2poTsTM36IFxhFQ.text: I love this place! The food is really good, everyone is SUPER FRIENDLY, and I'm a total regular here. This is my go to place for sushi downtown.

daDFhYDisexFLpSvnI2Rkg.text: Food is good and came out fast, service is great, especially in Phoenix.  That is what a nice restaurant supposed to be.

pa2-JESDdEgejTK7b9BcNw.text: The food is pretty ok. It's not send back to the kitchen gross, or rave about delicious. The crab was kind of on the fishy side the last time I had it, which seemed out of the ordinary.  I do have some pretty big gripes about the place though. It is hotter than hell every time I have eaten there, regardless of the season. It also doesn't matter what part of the room you are in.  The customer service is lacking. The waiter we had was very inattentive despite the fact there was only one other table in the place.  Lastly - $2 for 8oz of Coke? Never again.  We'll be back, just because there aren't many sushi places in the area, but I don't think I'll necessarily recommend it to my friends.

AKD08e8ka5XtSgToTjSyog.text: Simply amazing! I love this spot. I recently had a 1st date there and all the food was so fresh and packed with flavor! We started out with some edamame which was perfectly steamed and so so yummy with a hint of garlic and a touch of salt then we moved on to the sun devil roll which was to die for! I especially loved the kick the jalapenos gave it. Even the spicy tuna had an extra kick of flavor. All I can say is if you haven't been... YOU NEED TO GO!

O7w1dlSQA4vAdLrs3rW8YQ.text: Pros:  Fun, open decor. Great alcohol selection.  The food is tasty.  You can get fresh wasabi if you ask.   Cons: Too loud inside, music doesn't match decor.  Uncomfortable chairs, even with the pads, my back was killing me.  The waitress said the fresh wasabi was free, until the check came. Overpriced.    For a place in this price range, I expect way less cons.   Why I gave 2 stars: the waitress decided that we didn't tip her enough, so she doubled it. What happened was we had a $100 meal, and split the check. My friend put the tip ($25 = 25%) on his card. Later that month we were looking at our credit card bills, and we were both charged $75 dollars. Thats a $50 tip on a $100 meal. My calls to the management remain unreturned after a month.   I probably would have gone their again, but not after that.

hioW0R-lHxFtm6VeGK8T7g.text: Went for happy hour. No amazing deals. Cocktails were good, but small. Waiter was on point with refilling our waters. Might've been because it was happy hour, but the sushi was entirely average.   The atmosphere of the place was cool, even though it was dead. Seemed like a cool neighborhood spot.

xsnEH1hLVaRZpsFUSbXyHw.text: Their sushi is terrible.  Went here after reading reviews for their HH sushi.  Ordered their Las Vegas roll. There was no salmon, no cream cheese, no avocado. I double checked with one of the sushi chefs at the bar that what I had received was truly the Las Vegas, and he confirmed the order was correct.  Then, when I tried to tell him what is supposed to be in a standard Las Vegas, he got smart with me.  The drink menu and decor is interesting/modern, but I wouldn't come back again.

fJPgxPOMY60VMw5i5gOx0A.text: The most amazing sushi. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the valley. The jade and tiger rolls are amazing. The Hama chili is a great app. The mochi is to die for. I've never had a problem with the service either. I recommend this place to any sushi lover a million times over.

vTAItGxJtFW1QWj9rpDM2A.text: Good not great, but only a short walk from my place. If you don't get the happy hour menu you can easily spend $50-60 without blinking an eye for food that is just good enough.  Pros- in the neighborhood and cool vibe  Cons- price, quality and horribly uncomfortable seating.   I'll go back only because I don't care to drive elsewhere.

j4URRD7gxAakzYulefWRMg.text: I visited Moira Sushi for the first time this last weekend with a girl friend. We sat at the sushi bar. The server was friendly and attentive and was really quite busy, being that it was a Friday night. Our food was delicious and I love how my Diet Coke arrived in a cute little glass bottle! They even worked around my avocado allergy. Thanks Moira Sushi! I'll be back :)

9QJmUGasOns_j2I0flrP1Q.text: Went to dinner here with some girlfriends during a weekend reunion in Phoenix.  I had the fried tofu appetizer and an avocado roll with plum wine, and they  both had shrimp tempura rolls and a rainbow roll.  We were all pleased with the fresh ingredients and service, but when the requested separate checks were processed, 2/3 bills were put on one card.  This was corrected by the waitress (who did not collect/process the checks), but the mistake shows lack of detailed work from all employees.

040CH_w-lwhgxBiWPqhGIQ.text: Funky spot next to art district.  Most interesting thing about their food is the appetizers. Hot stone for cooking your own thin sliced beef.  The sushi is good & atmosphere enjoyable, we brought our 3 year old &  it was a bit of a challenge on a busy Friday night.

WCHSIULoicr4W5Tj-FC3XQ.text: Excellent place downtown for Sushi and drinks. Great happy hour. A+++

XX-sfmQCjZQsFq3ErC_jvw.text: This is a tough review to write because I had really high expectations for this place. One huge positive here is that they do a Saturday reverse happy hour after 9pm so I brought a group of 6 in for drinks and snacks. The service itself was pretty good and our server was SUPER-SWEET AND COOL and but the food was disappointing. I ordered the volcano roll which had a mushy texture and a rather unpleasant flavor overall. I tasted the spicy tuna and did not care for it. My plum wine was nice and I enjoyed the fried chicken wings on the happy hour menu, but it was INCREDIBLY loud. They had a DJ spinning which was a nice touch but it was so damn loud (uncomfortably so) that I could barely hear my dining companions or the server.   I MIGHT be apt to try it again because it is a really lovely little joint and the happy hour prices are fantastic.  In the meantime, however, 2 stars.

lkPtqfmoNR5jyjPKkNW6qQ.text: 4/5 Stars  Appetizer: Ordered the crackling calamari, which was much larger than anticipated. The sauce was the best part, and gave the dish a great flavor! I also ordered a cup of miso soup, which was delicious! I've never met a miso I didn't like (4/5 Stars on all apps).  Sushi Rolls: Our favorite roll was the Sunshine roll, spicy salmon and lemon slices. (4/5 Stars)There's something about a lemon slice that gives a great citrus flavor to a roll. Hands down my favorite roll will always be topped with lemon. We also ordered the Spicy Hana and Sun Devil rolls. Both great flavor, but nothing too special. (3/5 Stars)

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Sun devil
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cracking calamari, great app to share!
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best roll on the menu! Sunshine

DSp0A1D2AAZ4rPBNFBbzKA.text: Went here for lunch, really enjoy the lunch special that they have. It starts off with a small soup, then a home salad that is incredible ! After you have your choice of a roll, sushi burrito, or a bowl. The food was very tasty and will defiantly be back.   I looked at their hours and was very surprised to see how late they are open, I've noticed many restaurants around here close around 10 or 11 so it is a great option to have late at night.

UOkmRzRCPw4oH0Ov0OmVZQ.text: I was here over the weekend. The food and services is always fabulous! The parking meters out front are my only complaint . You can't see the meter even with phone light. The location is fun, Cobra arcade is across the street along with other places to near by.

99Ok84lEmDyxw-Veao3Qzw.text: First, our server was fantastic. When my friend was unsure of what kind of drink she wanted he concocted a specialty drink for her made with flavors she liked. Second, all of the food was phenomenal. Great flavors and fresh taste. Definitely will go back!

cYOQEDUsVq-TlD06-kYXRw.text: Best sushi in town .......love it especially happy hour frpm 5 to closed the drinks are perfect love it and the employees are nice ....

td1Lf_8v5buqkWwU9Heg7g.text: You really go here for the ambiance. It's edgy and classy at the same time. The sushi is impressive visually,  but flavor wise it's just standard and quite pricey. They really fall short on alcohol here. My companions got the same sake, one got a real wine glass, the other got a literal shot glass. I tried a version of a kentucky smash and it was so sweet it was undrinkable. Our waitress replaced it with another drink, a coconut lemon grass one and that one was unfortunately just as sweet.    There was at least two times where we were left looking for our waitress.   Location is great, but overall unremarkable

XhVF5sMi92g1lPWEEe8yXA.text: For a first timer, I have to say that this place is freaking awesome! Last Thursday, my friend recommended that I should give this place a try and he was right! The food was great especially the Moira Wings; they're to die for. The crispness was perfect as well as the sauce that it was tossed in. The only gripe that I have was the Japanese fried rice, I ordered it with shrimp and wasn't particularly fond of tails being left on. Any who, the two sushi rolls I ordered were excellent and spicy--the way I like it--and the Lux cocktail was delicious with the right amount of oomph. It was money well spent and I will definitely be coming back for more!

RMhmcUIigQbfnCrqZM-jag.text: I've experience many sushi spots and can say this place isn't in my top three. The staff  seemed unorganized as to where to sit people promptly. Also, I was surprised they didn't serve Sapporo or Kirin Ichiban beer. Those are like the best Japanese beers to pair with sushi in my opinion. The sushi it self is ok.

LEn3g02z__70uUrO2Xlubw.text: We came to Moira sushi for a friend's birthday.  We didn't have any issues with service - our waitress was prompt and friendly.  We had a great bottle of Seven Hills wine.  The sushi was good, but not better than many cheaper places in the Valley.  We had a cool appetizer where you cooked your own beef on a hot stone, but the amount of food you get for the price you pay isn't ideal.  Still, it's a prime area of town at a classy joint, so you're probably paying some for ambiance.    Decent food for a somewhat expensive price.

gaNH7qki9Nuq2yHnrzHxjw.text: This place use to be a 5 star restaurant. I've been coming here since they first opened and I'm very disappointed of how my last visit went. To start of, the service was ok...it took about 45 minutes to receive our order and it wasn't even busy. When we finally got our order it was completely wrong and had to send everything back. Our waiter was nice and comped our bottle of wine for the mishap. It's sad to see a place that once had great service and promptness go so down hill. The place has a great  happy hour, location, and atmosphere, but I feel as if the owner is absent and is letting the restaurant  go. I don't think I will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z_H10ppIhg6RHn-PkHbiig.text: The service has been awful the majority of our visits here. Slow, inattentive or rude wait staff is usually the norm. However, the evening-long happy hour is unbeatable, and that's Moira's saving grace.  The sushi is fresh and delicious. I rarely venture outside of spicy tuna, so I can't speak to any of their specialty rolls however.   The appetizers are great, the edamame and squid/octopus salad are my favorites to share with the table.

7Srr4lrJT0CdywK-5qJSDg.text: Only came to Moira's because Sean and Eli know how to take care of a big party. They really took care of us and even got my boy a birthday desert for free!!!!

kbs0341-SDccNrulHiE65A.text: If you're a fan of sushi and a fan of happy hour, this is your place. A friend and I were heading out for Thai food when we discovered the restaurant was closed that day. We agreed sushi was the next best thing so we ended up here. And it was happy hour. To our surprise, the happy hour menu was huge with food selections and VERY reasonably priced. The atmosphere is intimate. The server was friendly and helpful when it came to what we should order next. For two people just eating (no alcohol), it was around $45-$50 and we ate A LOT! Well worth it.

QWZRSA0wLPAywYo8_VxTPw.text: I went to Moira for lunch today and was super disappointed. I had been previously for dinner and really enjoyed it, but today's lunch was very overpriced and super underwhelming. First of all, the sodas that we were charged $3.50 for were flat. When we asked if there were other sodas available since our Cokes were flat, we were told that they all came from the same machine and that they were waiting on a shipment of CO2. It would have been nice when we ordered sodas for him to have told us they were flat if they knew their machine was out of CO2. Everything just seemed a bit dirty and rundown. When the food came, there was a bug in the soy sauce when we poured it out of the jar. It is a shame, because it used to be a great place. I don't know if they are just struggling and cutting corners or what. But our VERY underwhelming lunch and sodas cost us almost $60, which was insane! Hopefully they can fix their issues!

oJbHRlgDP4UufOzFkH1_MA.text: Awesome food and service.  Gus our sushi guy knows how to make some killer rolls. Great happy hour specials.

akYGyHoOWTCT33Eckz5UOQ.text: I had been looking forward into stopping into Moira for a while and finally found the opportunity. We shared the calamari appetizer which comes with both tubes and the little octopi (FYI in case they frighten you in that form). I ordered the yufu roll, which i loved! It came with tuna and salmon on top of the room and yummy shrimp tempura inside. We ordered a red lady and echigo imperial stout and really enjoyed both drinks. This place would be great for happy hour because it is a little pricey but we really enjoyed our first experience here!

Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari
