-wm2mOIZIzDya1Re_3IYQQ.text: Excellent food and great service! The food was very flavorful and was well presented. The service was fast and friendly.

fR4SXNCr8dsesKymI4d11w.text: Really enjoyed my meal here! My date used to frequent here because he lived quite close to it. Not so much now. But when we were conveniently close by at Phoestivus and not interested in the food trucks, his immediate suggestion was Moira! It really is off the beaten path because in the many time I've been in the neighborhood bar hopping, I'd never seen or noticed it.   "Happy hour" until 11p wins in my book. We ate well for $40 including a couple of drinks, a couple of rolls and an appetizer. I was underwhelmed by my drink but you can't beat $5 wells. The rolls were crazy good and surprisingly filling, and their eel sauce is outta this world. Get the bang bang shrimp for your appetizer as a precursor to the amazingness you're about to eat.   My only complaint was the service. We were greeted and sat at the bar, and promptly forgotten about until I got up after 10 minutes to ask someone for waters and to take our order. Then once we got our drink order placed and gave the chef our sushi order, it took another 10-15 to get our drinks and some water. By no means were they slammed so genuinely curious what the issue was.   Definitely willing to come back again when I'm in the area though.

wDgsFPh_ijVuH_2iZfZfRA.text: We love their sushi! The 3 stars are because my wife and I came in at 5:45pm on a Thursday with maybe 6 patrons already there and the hostess said that we couldn't sit at a regular table because they save them for larger parties. Since when does dining as a couple deserve punishment? I don't like sitting at sushi bars because my feet dangle and I feel like a child. So she offered us the "shorter sushi bar". My chin hit the fricken bar it was so ridiculous. We got "table" sized chairs with a 4" concrete bar in front of them. It didn't fit. At all.  By the time we were done not even half the restaurant was full and 2 2-tops were still empty! Not happy.  5-star sushi, nori puffs, happy hour prices  1-star for forcing shorties to sit at a sushi bar. That sucked.

YwDbfqDyrJl-XyKZz1c9zw.text: Take out review. 5 star service. I ordered the 2 miso soup,  Senna roll, Spicy lobster, Sun devil, Kani crunch roll, and Szechwan garlic edamame. Everything was fresh but my favorite was the miso soup and must try the edamame.

gNR0uDe-5HNZOlafIfL9dg.text: Stopped in for lunch on a whim and were pleasantly surprised. We shared the cracking calamari which was a hit, then chef's choice sashimi which was fantastic. The white tuna was our hands down favorite. Finished off with the Konbo roll which was also very good. Service was great. Highly recommended.

lT23NGVGwy1Kbtd4EFOHIA.text: First time not sitting at the sushi bar. Sat near the window among the other socially maginifient people that were also enjoying my favorite sushi lounge. Loved that area too.  So I came here to let you mainly know rice saki is delicious too.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Saki anyone?? Comes hot or cold. Note worthy, not all saki comes with the beer.  % Levels

2KJMPEvJbv6uCNnsvDfP-g.text: A nice place for sushi.  It's comfy setting is good for couples looking to cozy up to one another and have a date.  The food is okay (now my reference is San Francisco places) and fairly par for course.  Nothing surprising or shockingly awesome.  Service however is great and the staff is top notch.

DyMsMX9O9hFjxk2K2BhodA.text: Have been here several times had some of the greatest service and not as great at other times but overall I would say it's a great place to eat... Service I give 4 stars there is a guy there with curly hair that is exceptionally good at his job. The food I rate 5 stars its very good. And the cleanliness I would rate a 4 most of the time I'm there it's packed which may be why. Overall the food makes up for the rest I drive from San Tan when I have a sushi craving just to go here.

6RlvZbBc6S1fAzJsObt7aQ.text: We come here all the time during the week (I think happy hour prices run all night Monday through Thursday).  We only order from the happy hour menu, which is very extensive and reasonably priced.  Everything I've tried has been great.  Never had to wait very long for a table, if at all.

2OE_VBsz7XyODD43p4l6Vw.text: Was pretty disappointed with this place. Pros are the ambience and restaurant interior. Very clean and fun. However, from a food quality and quantity standpoint, it was disappointing. Ordered a roll for $12, which came with the stingiest portion of salmon ever (see attached pics below). It was so thin it was translucent and you could see the rice below. The ginger was also dried and old, definitely not fresh. Did order a hamachi appetizer for $7, which was tasty but overpriced (came with 4 tiny slices). Will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roll came with 8-9 pieces just like this. $12.

1Wef4IH7IUvBeMJ8sl-pGQ.text: Perhaps I was just cranky after my disappointing meal at Sens, but we walked in to Moira thinking it couldn't get much worse. WRONG. What's up with the glow lights under the bar? Lame. What's up with the uncomfortable metal chairs? Double lame.  We had already had a few dishes at Sens so we weren't all that hungry and just ordered the tempura shrimp and the jade roll. The menu boasted that the shrimp came sprinkled with shichimi "seven tastes".. Is that the 7 tastes of the oil it was fried in? That's what it tasted like..  The jade roll was soft shell crab, avocado and cucumber. Sounds good right? Not when it is served HOT. Who ever heard of a hot sushi roll?   So ended the night with two bad experiences at down town restaurants. Triple lame ;(

rbvySmWzrnWZo4UHpeO6oQ.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in Phoenix.  A bit expensive but they have the yummiest sushi. I love the interior and the overall vibe in the place. Definitely try the dragon roll. It's was my favorite, along with the spicy Hanna. Had me like "daaaaamn." I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 cause they have the weirdest hours and it's hard to catch them when they're open.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dragon roll. So yummy.

VdG93xrF7JAdQulQOQ-TiA.text: Ok food, but way too loud ... if you're in college, it's a blast I'm sure ... but at my age, having the people at the next table playing drinking games (yes, that's True)  isn't my idea of a peaceful evening.   Service is a bit slow and confused, but everyone was pleasant ... it's a decent fallback sushi place if you can't get into Squid Ink, but not my first choice.

hqluzuEN5WhudeMPApGSnA.text: First time here after moving DT. I must say i am surprised this place is not packed during Happy Hour. Really good and Fresh Squid And Sea weed Salads. For 5 bucks you get a Great Spicy Tuna Roll. I will be back for sure.  Came back for more and the Music is so loud you can not enjoy the place nor have a conversation

eF1lTk8lj1LASpdl0YGedQ.text: I am just not a fan of this place.  I've given it three separate chances, with three completely different dinner partners.  Each time was worse than the time before.  The sashimi was rather warm, the rolls lackluster.  The cocktails, while tasty, are very expensive.  And somebody must have hired their cousin as a DJ, because some kid set up speakers and a laptop behind the bar area and proceeded to drive us crazy with his inability to (even try to) beatmatch.  I'm not sure how so many people find this place a winner.  Maybe they've never eaten sushi in a really good establishment.  A bummer, because I love downtown Phoenix and I really want to support the restaurants in this area.  I just can't bring myself to hit this place up again.  :/

l3SQWDdZ2JSGjcMjK7SSJw.text: Stopped in for lunch. No one said anything to us when we stepped inside but the waitress came over within a minute or so. The seats had crumbs and food in them, and the tables all looked filthy. Like no one wiped them down after each patron left. Soy sauce was molded to the table proving this. My silverware was spotty and the soy sauce dish was dirty as well. I asked for another and the waitress just kinda said "Oh", like no big deal that's normal :(  Food was ok....wings a funny after taste but were hot and made to order. Sushi was fine, no complaints. Rice dish was ok as well. My friend are it all and said he enjoyed it.    I'd like to give an additional half star since the waitress seemed to be on top of her tables considering she was the only one on shift that day. I'd probably try to-go, but I'd be hesitant to dine in or trust that the kitchen is cleaner than the dining room. That said, maybe I wouldn't do take out either.

7qXF0t4gx56WBehGblKowA.text: Sorry gang...still can't recommend this place.  My reputation is on the line and I gotta be honest,  if I ever tell you go to this place; please forgive me.  I enjoy the atmosphere, but service is still lacking.  I've been a server and the last thing I want my customers to do is to chase me down.  If I start feeling like I've been a burden to you then my visit is just not worth it.    I do enjoy the food -- the Udon noodle is good, but there wasn't any of the Japanese beer left for me to order.  Apparently, they ran out - but don't tell me you can't order more.  In today's market and economy I'm sure if you want it, you can get it.  Orion & Asahi is good, but I can get those anywhere.  -- Enjoy (I think)

N9wVvpWQB3gmL6EtNO9E1A.text: Not a huge fan. Here's what's up.. The place is for sure cool looking. Great vibe. Service is good too. The only thing I like there is the Crackling Calamari. Oh damn good happy too.   The sushi was just bland tasting.

O2Y5lJXn9az6BGDH0LwThQ.text: This place was pretty good. Our waitress, Megan, was super sweet and very helpful - I would give her a 5. There was no wait to be seated, which was nice. I had the rainforest sushi roll - it was ok, kind of bland. The garlic edamame was REALLY good, lots of flavor.

-dMmjQ_i7bhfcoOk44gHhw.text: Ended up here while looking for sushi near the convention center. It's a little hidden off the main road. Not good.  Pros: Decor is actually really nice and modern. Bathrooms are nice, but dirty.  Cons: Food was not good. Sashimi was rubbery, rolls were sticky/rubbery and not tasteful. They only have cans, no fountain drinks, which is embarrassing in 2016. Not a very extensive menu and food was just not good at all. We had several  sashimi and nigiri, rolls and poke.  I will definitely not eat here again.

j2bUHt1VMk5t8Kg-d_QVmA.text: It's only 10:44 and Moiras is supposed to be open till 11. Felt crazy rushed as we drank our sake and tried to eat our food but they literally turned the lights out at 10:30! While we were eating. We arrived around about 945 thinking we had more than enough time to have food and drinks but I guess I was wrong? So if you're looking for a late night bite or drink don't come here. Cobra is across the street and so is Snoh and they would never rush out a costomer and turn the lights off on you as you're eating. (One extra star because happy hour is great but not when you're rushed.)

UWuEh85MM_5-b8U-4_dKDA.text: Super trendy place and open late. I LOVE the chicken wings, so good. I crave them all the time. Service can be slow, and music is loud, but it's fun for a night out.

MAM2iSknWxRUJfHv2D29nw.text: Very decent Reverse Happy Hour for when you want sushi post First Friday or to get your Saturday night started out on the town. The music is a tad loud for my liking. Within walking distance to fabulous Roosevelt Row. And I always wonder about who lives above it....those places look way cool.

zD0LjnRQ4pQNvzdo84NhMA.text: Just moved in around the corner and discovered this place.  Food is very solid (some big hits and a few okays) and service attentive.  They have an excellent Happy Hour Monday through Thursday from 5:00 - Close.  Excellent wine by the glass prices and great prices on HH dishes.  We happened in last night and to my delight found out that Thursday is 1/2 price wine by the bottle night.  Had an excellent bottle of Pine Ridge Viognier/Chenin Blanc for $14.  That's pretty close to what you pay for it at the store.  The real delight of the evening was their fried calamari appetizer.  It's one of the best HH dishes I've ever had.  Not only was it delicious but a substantial portion for $5.  The calamari were breaded and cooked to perfection.  They were mixed with al dente carrots, onions, bell pepper and mushrooms.  Served on a bed of cabbage and tossed with a magnificent slightly spicy sauce.  It was so good I almost ordered another.  Our server Kiana was delightful, efficient and attentive.  If you are lucky enough to get her as your server tell her we said hi.  This place is definitely worth the effort to get to if only for the calamari.  Oh, an added bonus is the nice outdoor patio.

RmAcAb30lgphZk4DURVB8Q.text: I've been in here for lunch a few times, and each time I've gone, it hasn't been very busy at all. Pretty much it's just been myself and my coworkers. BUT the sushi has been really great every time we go. Really like this place.

jFydE2uiqa5dPZhaPQczuA.text: The food and drinks were great but the waitress was really rude...forgot to bring half the stuff we ordered and then tried to kick us out of our seats for a larger party. Never come here if you want to chill on a Friday night.? Or First Friday!!

tE5RF9HBfMHVCvR1NZaBnA.text: Horrible service. When we were being sat, I started to give my drink order to the person seating us. She interrupted me to tell me she wasn't our server and then left. Ok. So, another server brought us waters and when I tried to give her our drink order, she also informed me that she want our server and left. Ok. So then our server came and I ordered our drinks. Cool. Then my husband came back from the bathroom and I was telling him about what happened and then the first person that sat us came over to me and asked me if I had a problem. Seriously? I was telling my husband what happened and you just HAD to come over and say that to me? I told her, " I'm just telling my husband what happened," then she interrupted me again telling me I must have a problem and that I was talking a lot of shit. I asked the sushi chef her name and he said he didn't know. I told her your owners going to be losses because you let customers go out the door for something like this. I asked the sushi chef, " so you don't know her name?" He said she was the manager and he didn't know her name. We walked out and she was still talking g at us as we were leaving. The food isn't exactly great at this place and. Ow with the horrible service, is never come back again. I'm still in awe.

tX9qXXcy6vBS8oaKCJtaEw.text: Finally, a good spot in downtown Phoenix for sushi. Much better than the fast-foodish Ichi Ban on Central near Thomas. Really good decor, and very good quality sushi. Was practically empty today during lunch though. Hopefully business will pick up and this place will be around for a good little while.

TWy2nXEmPOLRk6hvj9PbFg.text: Finally, a good sushi restaurant in downtown Phoenix with a cool atmosphere.  The decor is cool, without trying too hard.  The music was awesome - Thievery Corporation, Midwest Product, etc.  However, most importantly, the sushi was fresh, tasty, and artfully displayed (I love when they give the Caterpillar roll little eyes).  My only complaint was speed of service.  I went for lunch and took a little too long for the rolls to come out.    I am so excited to have such a cool place in my neighborhood!

sYjIJWuHp49JNW4ywTzadA.text: I don't know if I'm really digging on these hip sushi joints.. I prefer the more 'traditional' places where everyone working the place screams "IRASSHAIIIIIIII" in Falsetto when you walk in the door.   -The fried tofu was delicious, I think there were chunks of wasabi in it.  -I really liked the presentation of the miso, but 1.) it was lukewarm, 2.) the crock was too big for our little table (plus: nowhere to put the lid), 3.) the ladle was as big as the miso spoons themselves (what's the point???) and it kept falling in to the soup as we tried to maneuver the crock around. Points for form, but function...? fail.  -The spicy tuna was the most satisfying of the bunch.  -The Philly roll was cream cheese overload... more salmon, please!  -The Fuji was pleasantly spicy.  -The Rainbow Roll was disappointing... whatever it was sitting in (mirin?) was completely overpowering and made the roll a little soggy.

7UohaJS1y5cr8i2Mce3FCQ.text: Not a huge fun of the new menu. I think sushi is one of those things that should remain pretty True to tradition and I think the chef too too many liberties. The food is usually tasty, just a little too "un-sushi". Still love the decor, vibe and service.

X4U5jYN02l6lfCJ5t5Q_zg.text: I was pleasantly surprised when my coworkers and I decided to eat here dinner here on a Friday night.  The decor is usual for an asian/sushi joint.  The price wasn't bad for good sushi.  I think our bill came to $180 for four people who ate a lot of food and drinks.  Our waiter was pretty flamboyant and we loved him.  He was pretty good about suggesting things and steering us away from things he thought we wouldn't like.  I ended up getting the Sunshine (which was AMAZING), Kamikaze and  Kakuna - all were very good with fresh ingredients.  They were good portion sizes (I didn't actually finish all of my 3rd roll) to fit each piece into your mouth without feeling like your choking on sushi :)  I will definitely come here again next time I'm in Phoenix.

m3GdWYgh_wAddkY7el50PA.text: Came here with my group of gal pals recently and I think we were all pretty impressed... I hadn't read any reviews beforehand, and I'm kinda glad.  Love the setting and I personally found the rolls to be pretty inventive, compared to your typical sushi joint, not compared to nobuo or roku, of course.   First off, the szechuan edamame was amazing.  I also had the pina roll and the one with beef and mushroom and they were both awesome. I really enjoyed the flavors of the beef and mushroom.  Something out of the ordinary.  I also liked the devil roll. They had icecream for dessert, which sounded good, but I'm usually looking for something crazy for dessert so skipped it.

rrtIqGYopa41X3anoSjutg.text: One of my all-time favorite restaurants in the greater Phoenix area. I go here with my girlfriend frequently and they never let us down. Located just around the corner from The Roosevelt. The main points I love about Moira are as follows. Ambiance- really genuinely hip in the sense of New York or San Francisco hip, cool under-bar lighting, massive golden Buddha statues, unique bathroom fixtures and great use of chain-mail curtains :). The whole place seems to maintain a very cool, but not pretentious understated vibe and they usually have some great house music playing. Food- the food is fantastic. Everything we've ordered has been very top notch. We don't do a ton of sushi but what we've had is very good. The dishes we absolutely love are the small stir fry dishes like the Donburi and Pho crunch (the latter is a genius work of texture and taste variations that keep me coming back over and over. The seaweed salad is consistently good and the bomb-diggety appetizer of them all are the Fried Tofu Nuggets- you'd swear they were chicken nuggets. Soooooo good! And the dipping sauce they come with is otherworldly. They have a really interesting list of cocktails which are all worth a try and all the wait-staff is super friendly and accommodating. Truly an understated, largely unknown, gem of a restaurant!

Dn8JlQzx_lfFcuOPptlrKg.text: I really liked Moira sushi, it was a nice change from the places i usually frequent for sushi. I thought the food was good - my spicy tuna was delicious. The drinks were also interesting and unique, which always makes it fun to try something new. The gin press was a little too strong for my taste but the Kiss and Tell was really good. Also the place itself had great atmosphere, the lighting and the decor made it  modern and cool. I wish the place was busier- for a Saturday night it was pretty empty, and I hope more people go downtown more - there are some awesome places just waiting to be found. Moira is one of them.

U9DKqXtCtWm4s_fMKKZveA.text: The service I got from here was the worst! The waiter was rude and kept forgetting what we asked for. On top of that we were forced to tip him 17%, and we weren't the only once, because of their new policy. I dont mind tipping at all but the service needs to be worth it! Also, on top of all this I was doubled charged! The manager did make try to make it a little better by offering a percentage off our bill on the next bill but with service like that even if it was free I will not return.

8tJi-J6MCeA-CHOc5R_OUA.text: I work service industry and I know good service from great and this place takes the cake. The sushi is spot on every time and the servers can mix a mean drink. Together with their killef happy hour (and reverse on the weekend) Moira is worth the drive if you don't live downtown and a local jewel if you're a townie. I can't rave about it enough.

ub5Kz_kRYbHIF5TquOz6Tw.text: The setting was perfect. Decor was very nice. Food presentation was good, but actual preparation was sub par. I will go back to give it another try because it's close to work, but not as good as I expected.

fHP8rvDH_Dh3ci0D5zOBdg.text: The atmosphere was pleasant.  The selection was good.  The tuna and salmon nigiri wasnt the best I have tasted.  It just seemed a bit unfresh.  The service was good.  I probably wouldnt go back anytime soon because its would be a long drive from Surprise but if I was in the neighborhood I may drop by.

8SNmf0TrZOyqjIHf1gv4eQ.text: Meh, I've experienced better is perfect to describe how I feel about Moira. I'm not sure I will go back...even if a friend offered to pay.    My search for good Japanese food in Phoenix continues....

ZTIhcC0I8ApDp96wzp28CQ.text: I was very excited to try this place - a good sushi place downtown would have been great.  However, it leaves much to be desired.  The tempura was not authentic tempura batter, it was some kind of thin, greasy batter that was not very appetizing. The vegetables were not the traditional ones used either - included red peppers, bok choi, baby corn, no zucchini or squash. The serving was large and we left most of it there (though I hate to waste).  The sushi was just ok.  I had a yellowtail roll, salmon roll, yellowtail nigiri, and smoked salmon nigiri.  As a couple posters below said, the toro was not good quality - unbelievably chewy with "strings" throughout, and with a funny taste - I couldn't even finish it (which is crazy).  It looked great, and the portion was generous, but that was it.  No comments about decor, I care most about the food.  Positives: green tea in a pot was nice, rice in sushi was decent, server was attentive.  If you live downtown, it's worth the drive to go to Hana instead.

_aR3aq7SLo1-3coqwku6-A.text: love it. good, fresh sushi, volcano roll was the best of our choices that night.  happy hour pricing was a plus.  definitely go back again!

SaG0BMnsV4NK3izNaEs3sQ.text: I was very pleasantly surprised with this place. I'm not from Phoenix and after looking very hard for somewhere fun, good and non-Mexican to go to, my friends and I finally found this cool spot. On top of being super cute, the food was very good and the drinks were (as our waiter called them) liquid deliciousness! It is too bad I don't live in Phoenix because I would definitely be a regular at this place. If you're going here for the first time you have to try their cucumber drink (I'm not sure of the name of it but it was something like chu-cumber). Its got muddled cucumber and some oriental alcohol but the harmonious balance between the cucumber, ginger and alcohol is perfect. All drinks are $9 or $10 bucks so getting drunk here can get pretty expensive.

hiTSt7scdq8aSxPo1Nz3dQ.text: One of my friends recommended this place for a sushi spot in downtown Phoenix near the light rail. The location is south of the Roosevelt and I must have driven by it many times. I enjoyed the bar seating which allowed me to view all of the house specialties of which I will be back to try. For starters I had the spicy salmon served in baby greens, cucumber, avocado, radish sprouts, seaweed in spicy creamy dressing presented in a martini style glass. It was delicious! Since I love to sample, we ordered a few different rolls and some sashimi as well. The spicy yellowtail was delicious and fresh. My favorite was the volcano, with crab meat and a crispy outter shell and volcano sauce on top. I had a sake that I have not been able to find anywhere else. If you're a fan of sake, the must have here is the Shirakabe Gira. Overall, this place was delicious although a little pricey. I think the quality would justify the expense.

NJp7iXMTIv_6-f79vQFrAg.text: Went here for reverse HH last night. It started at 10:30 p.m. the prices were good, $5 for a roll, $3 for seaweed salad/calamari/edamame. I thought the sushi rice was a bit hard and packed too tightly. The hostess was not very friendly and this was consistent with the last time I went there. The waitress, however, was nice.  They no longer serve milk tea and I asked about all the other juices (mango, lychee, coconut, mandarin orange).  All came from a can so I did not order them. The best part about this restaurant was neither the food nor the drinks but the fact that it's downtown and open late with reasonable pricing. I would not necessarily go back for the food specifically or recommend it but if you just want to hang out and drink, it's a nice little place.

flaA3v_dwXFuRNYx01ze9Q.text: At the end of a very busy First Friday when you are hungry and the Roosevelt is packed, Moira is a great place to grab a few drinks and a late night snack.  It was busy but there was room at the sushi bar so we nestled in to a couple seats and glanced over the menu.  I wasn't in the mood for sushi and my friend is a vegetarian so we ended up with some edamame and fried tofu.  The fried tofu was really good actually.  Not your typical plain fried tofu cubes, nope this was stuffed with carrots and soy beans then served with a delicious plum sauce.  A little spicy but not too much and really the perfect night cap.  We sipped on our reverse happy hour beverages and enjoyed the quaint atmosphere and pleasant wait staff.  The reason it only gets three stars is because I can't see myself eating at Moira unless it is happy hour.  The prices are a little high otherwise if you ask me, and if I am going to pay a lot for sushi it has to be top notch.  I'm also not a big fan of $10 specialty drinks, I'd rather stay home and drink for a lot less.  And this may be silly but the bar stools are not comfortable so staying for a long period of time is out for me.  All in all Moira is decent and I'm sure I will go back because it is close to home but I can't see myself becoming a regular.

kZ7IIR6zRCST343-YmBURA.text: My favorite restaurant.  Try the Sakura roll and a bottle of Xingu!  You will NOT be disappointed.  The place is hip and beautiful -- great wait staff, excellent food and the music "Buddaha Bar" like (sometimes a tad too loud though).

nQr7fg9DBhpbL8EhCf_Q9A.text: How did I miss this? I'm the chick that bitches endlessly about the lack of sushi in the downtown/midtown area. Seriously, how.... in the hell.....did I miss this??   Anyway, I love this place. The sushi was fantastic (in my opinion) but then again I'm not some self important sushi snob, so take that for what it's worth. Everything tasted fresh and the service was great. The only complaint I have is the chairs..... who's brilliant idea were those horrible wire chairs. My bony ass was not happy after sitting there for an hour and a half.  Whatever, I found a new date spot. The bf was as impressed as I was and since we live so close I'm sure Moira will be in regular rotation. Screw you Zen

2xSyhyRH35ghsW7sbJnh0Q.text: I enjoyed my experience here. The sushi was fresh when I went, it seems as though other yelpers haven't had my luck. The rolls are original, I like that they have less of the shrimp tempura in their rolls. Their concept is more of a 'club sushi' atmosphere- great for a date, or late-night. My favorite thing about Moira was the sake-fusion drinks. So awesome! The one negative is the cramped tables- I recommend the sushi bar.

49UqA_-llOAO6grFicuppw.text: "Meh" is exactly right for this place. After reading all the 4-5 star reviews on opening night, I was really excited to finally have a sushi place downtown. Needless to say, I was very underwhelmed by the whole experience.   Miso soup was sub-par at best. You'll get much better Miso at Hana (7th Ave & Missouri) or Yasu (near PV mall). Miso is my favorite part of the whole sushi experience, and they did just about everything wrong with it.   Prices were what you would expect for good sushi, but definitely over-priced for the quality that was served here.   Good sushi is about fresh fish, so my husband and I like to ask the chef's for their recommendation for the night. The chef here sent us out toro (it's the fatty part of the tuna, good toro is like biting through butter) which also happened to be the most expensive fish they had. I couldn't even chew through this toro, if this was the freshest fish they had then I am seriously concerned about the quality of their fish. It was like chewing a tough piece of steak and very unpleasant.   The chef came out to ask us if we liked the toro, and when we told him it wasn't good he got very offended and insulted us (basically said that it was because we couldn't tell good fish from bad fish).   Wait staff was also slow (we were the only people there) and didn't know anything about their menu or sushi. Chairs were uncomfortable (they were wire frames, kinda like shopping carts). Tables were too small (every plate and glass on our table was literally touching everything else b/c there was no room).   I could go on and on with the things they did wrong...but I think you get the idea.

0ZRjyKrCZvaEGey0n6vAgQ.text: I hate to write a review of a place on the day it gets ROTD, but why not? I'll bask in your glory, Kristin S.   Moira is hot. Like, super sexy. This is the kind of place you take a date to seal the deal. Sexy decor, sexy lights, sexy sushi chefs (if that's what they are called?), sexy bathrooms, sexy metal bead things that lead to the bathrooms, sexy music.   Being a vegetarian I always get the same thing at every sushi place I visit, so I can spot a good veggie roll when I see one. It's easy to tell that the quality of ingredients are above average and super tasty. They have a delish white ale. The HH is awesome and prices in general are fabulous.  Words to the single ladies out there, hit up Moira when you are looking for some sexy. Sushi is way less complicated than a man!

Ffuk_9p-zTMTqeFIjbRiiQ.text: Wanted Sushi and this is literally the only sushi place in downtown Phoenix ... It was a great atmosphere and quiet enough for a working business lunch with a colleague.  Highly recommend this establishment!  Mattie was our server and he did a great job and recommended outstanding dishes!  He accommodated our need to stay passed their normal lunch hour!  I look forward to my next sushi craving!

BFrZM8sCA4yDA_v92nQSyA.text: I like Moira.  I've only had sushi there, so I can't comment on the rest of the menu.  The fish is fresh, I especially like the yellowtail.  It's not the best sushi I've ever had, but I have no specific complaints about it, and that is saying something.    The service is always attentive and friendly.  I really have nothing negative to say here other than the chairs are too high at the sushi bar.  I feel like a child in a high chair since I pretty much need someone to push me in once I'm in the chair!  Oh and the music is always just a little too loud.  It's never more than half full there, and that is too bad.  I think people just don't know about it.  It's in kind of a lonely spot on McKinley and easy to miss if you're not watching for it.

-dl0nDbfBzZ47VtT5422LA.text: It hurts me to say this, fue to the fact that I love local businesses in my hood and I fully support them, but here is another restaurant that I wish would have been better...  Good news...More restaurants opening in Downtown, more options especially late night options...  Bad news...More restaurants opening in Downtown wanting to make a quick buck but does not deliver on food and quality...  I came here with a couple of friends really excited to try the only sushi restaurant in DT open for dinner.  There has been some good review on the place and I wanted to give it a chance...I should have gone north to Hana or Yasu! Walking in, I noticed the decor was another warehouse looking restaurant trying to be modern...only thing is , its not.  From the neon lights under bar to the wood paneling to the tin like tables, chairs, and barstools...its been done 30 times over.  I wish it had more character, a little bit more distinctive.  We are in the art district.  I don't want to walk in a restaurant that looks similar to ones that are already open in the same area?  Okay enough with that, the artist in me is rambling again..sorry..back to the "food" review.  Food:  The menu to me was a little confusing.  For being a Sushi joint, it had so many other things also, mostly stirfry items.  I decided to stick to what I came here to try, sushi.  I ordered squid salad to start.  I should not have ordered that to start.  The salad was so salty and it was drowning in dressing...bad start...I then ordered some sashimi including saba, sweet shrimp, and of course my favorite toro.  I was a little disappointed that they did not have uni..how can you not have uni!  Saba...not bad... Sweet Shrimp....foul tasting Toro.....couldn't even bite through it A good sushi joint has to have fresh fish...good sushi needs to be executed by a sushi chef with good knife skills...simple as that.. When your fish is not that fresh and your sushi chef fish slicing techniques are not there, you have a losing combo.  My friend out of frustration had the head chef make us something...He brought out the geisha roll. Spicy tuna is not my thing but out of courtesy, we did ask him to pick, I tried it..it was ok, again I am not too keen on chopped up tuna, which in this case tasted like it was food processed.  A little too mushy..  Drinks: Beers: Been done.  Infused vodkas: Been done Cocktails: Been done.  Good Points:  Nice staff, cool Teapots, and clean restrooms  All in all, I guess I was hoping for a sushi joint that was more innovative and creative with equally good skills to execute.  Maybe I am too harsh.  Or maybe I am just saying it how it is...As I left the joint, I felt like I have been to a sushi restaurant like that so many times before...  Hopefully they will succeed with less critical customers unlike myself..best of luck!!

ZKYyQ_IeABbFJVRSKg-ZUA.text: Rice was very grainy, fresh wasabi wasn't chopped wasabi and was charged extra for, no uni (not like one should even consider eating uni here), above average prices, all sushi came out at once, rolls with weird looking and tasting vegetables like marinated peppers, and weird tuna tataki roll.  Miso soup: There is no seaweed in it.  Salmon was ok but nothing spectacular. One of the rolls had lemon on top of the Salmon. For me there's nothing worse to ruin raw salmon than to put lemon on top of it.  Toro: Mediocre at best. I've had regular Bluefin that was superior to this over-priced Bluefin Belly (11$ for Nigiri).  The Vietnamese Ice coffee, while good and flavorful, was not as good as it is in real Vietnamese restaurants and really doesn't belong on the menu of a Sushi restaurant.

l774q3W4Evw-qRwYZet2Kg.text: Came, saw, left. Couldnt even get a refill on a glass of water...but that shrimp stuff was pretty good. . . ..

o5H4i2BGlGux1EmB28_ikA.text: 3 stars= A-OK  Red miso soup was lukewarm, ehhhh, whatever  Salmon nigiri cuts were subpar- no equal veining of fat lines... but still tender!  Though I would have preferred the veining....  Toro was excellent!  Rolls were good, but the rice was a bit on the dry side  Service was excellent, but the sushi did take awhile (I assume this is because of the new-ness of the place)  I did LOVE the fact that they had fresh wasabi (extra charge and it was pureed) I did LOVE that they had Vietnamesse iced coffee and sweet green tea!!  So yes, I will be back.  Hopefully the sushi chefs will have more experience.  Still a few bugs to be worked out, but the owner was awesome and I have high hopes!

bw8UacMfi37MmtvIb94hJg.text: Oh so trendy and expensive!  This place has good sushi, good stirfrys...but given the choice, I always head to Kyoto in Scottsdale for my sushi because it's good AND cheap.  Moira's a good place for a date...or for happy hour.  Not a place to come if you're really hungry and don't have a wad of cash to drop.

EFmG_UpdZentO8dgdw0ZHw.text: I have been here a few times and I must say, the ambiance of the establishment is sleek and comfortable.  The staff is very helpful and we've had fun every time we've been there...sure the drinks help but that's another story....  One of my favorite items is the calamari.  Now I realize it is different than you might have had in the past as it comes with a sauce that is a mix of sweet yet spicy.  If you are wanting the "same old thing" then go to the same old establishment and get it - but you won't find that here.  The dishes are fresh and new with tasteful enjoyment with each bite.  As far as entrees go, I LOVE the orange chicken.  My friend DOREEN P! (you have to say it like I wrote it)  really enjoyed the dragon and I must admit my byotch Jahmar orders that each time...well twice anyway.  I really enjoy this place...enjoy the food...and LOVE the staff.  Do I get a discount now????  OUT!

ZHSCZ8AeskTzbScBlRYd1Q.text: I must say I have had better sushi.  The decor was nice, comfortable and inviting with the exception of the music.  They played the uncensored version of  hip-hop and R&B  songs where they were dropping N and F bombs left and right.  Not exactly good dining music.  They might want to change that.

O_2_ycUBO_7PmKN8Op0fYw.text: I liked it. There were some highs, some lows and so we're going to go with a strong "like" of Moira.  The location is great - I love this little hub near Turf and Sens (and, conveniently, my good friend's apartment). It takes up the bottom floor of what appears to be residential in the upper floors? I might be wrong, but it's a nice use of space. No lot, so parking is kind of lame now that you gotta pump coins into the meters until 8p. But I just turned south on 3rd St. and parked a little ways down the road for free- no big deal.  The service was also great. Our server was friendly, comfortable and on his game. Coming by often (but without hovering or seeming pesky) to clear plates, get more drink orders, refill waters and get orders for party members who trickled in, in ones and twos. He had opinions on the food and drinks and was pretty helpful. At hh, they were plenty of rolls for around $5-$7.  The food was OK. I'm not a sushi person, so it appeared about the same as anything I've seen or tasted from Ra, to be honest. But others at the table had criticisms about what was possibly imitation crab in the Vegas Roll, and other shrug-able bites. Oh, I was intrigued by their edamame shui mai, crispy little balls filled with white fish and soy beans and that come out skewered on stick, and well presented/arranged in bowl. Simple enough to grab a stick and pass the bowl along to share. Cool and unique  Drinks - we were here on hh and I didn't even crack the regular menu, but decent hh specials for the atmosphere and cool-factor. I had an Asahi bomber for $7 and a specialty drink, the Sun Kiss for $6. There were also wine and beer options on the hh menu, but it was select list a drinks, not a catch-all $1 or $2 off deal.   The space is modern chic ... and a bit like every other new cool restaurant in that way. But I like the long sushi bar and about 10 other tables for parties of two and up to six. Lots of picture windows that look out on the street and would be a good spot to perch on First Friday. Bathrooms are well done (I love swanky bathrooms!).   Ah, my one gripe - we were there for about 1.5-2 hours and they had the Portishead cd on repeat. What, am I at the Roosevelt? What is with downtown hot spots 1. playing Portishead and 2. playing it over and over all night??

OMqUtWDneo9et5fs1te9GQ.text: There were some really good aspects about this place. I will go back in a year or so to check up on it.   The vietnamese coffee that they serve is a wonderful drink for a summer afternoon.   The rolls were interesting. Really analyze the ingredients before you order. Some are very lemony, others peppery, and others sweet.   The plates were not chilled. The rolls stuck a bit.

X6X1kf1dyc_J06t1anKTYA.text: Happy Hour at Moira,  M-Th 5p-7p Fri 10p-close! Sat 9p-Close.  This place shows those fufu places what a Japanese restaurant should stand for.  I loved the atmosphere.  As for the lights under the bar, well it looks good for the bar area, everywhere else has a warm modern Japanese style. Music was very nice and not extremely loud.   I had the Hamachi and the dragon roll. The dragon roll was amazing, a defiant suggestion.    I'm glad to add to the upward star rating this place shows definite improvement. Go enjoy

e88mZQCSy-FmW9bS-gfcRg.text: After my third visit to Moira, I decided it was time for a review. First, the good. The location right in the heart of CenPho is perfect. The venue appropriately decorated. The vibe is eclectic. Now for the not so good.  Each time I've dined there, dishes other than sushi were quite tasty, however their sushi really could use some work. When the name of your establishment contains the product you sell, you need to deliver on that one product above anything else. Moira fails to deliver in this critical area. To put into perspective, it is not that their sushi is bad, it is just mediocre and on par with Ra. So just in the same way that Ra is not necessarily bad, neither is Moira. But the expectation as a diner of a locally owned, unique restaurant, is that the experience would be better than a chain restaurant like Ra.  The first two times I dined at Moira, the service was acceptable, yet the third time was not. This was in spite of notifying Moira ahead of time that we would consist of a large dinner party of 12+ people. The night we dined, I saw all of two servers for the entire restaurant. It was not until later that a third server came on duty, but by then it was too late. For a dinner party as large as ours was, we really needed a dedicated server.

dpGVV6KqGpUVeKqdyraNEQ.text: Sefishly, my favorite thing about this place is that it's right in my hood, but I might still make the trip even if it wasn't oh-so-convenient.  I think the interior is well done. High ceilings accented with cool art pieces?  I likey.  The place is small, but it all works. For dinner, their rolls with a mixed drink are on the pricey side.  I LOVE their spicy tuna roll -- I know, what's so special about a spicy tuna roll?  It is pretty spicy, but it burns so good.  Check it out. Have a drink. Then walk home. My perfect place. Winner winner.

keNUrNsbp-pK3_Io5Nxapw.text: I like the atmosphere. I like the fact that a nice, modern sushi restaurant has opened in downtown Phx and it isn't Ichi Ban or Ra. (ugh). I love their selection of beverages...very tasty and somewhat eclectic. But that's about it. As good as their Thai coffee is, I'm afraid I don't go to sushi restaurants for my daily dose...sorry.  I am a HUGE sushi fan. By sushi I mean RAW FISH. Where's the sashimi menu? No uni? Yes, it is better to be *out* of uni rather than serve *old* uni...but to not have any? Very sad.  Freshly ground wasabi? Now there's something to talk about. NOM NOM NOM NOM.  But that's about it. The rolls were good, but trying too hard to be unique rather than flavorful. The plates were warm and half the rice from the one roll I did have stuck to it.  Moira has a great base to work with...but they'd best get it together soon.  Next time I'm in Phoenix I may stop by again, but more likely than not I think I'll save 50% on the bill and roll over to Sakana off I10/Elliott

a5-pfiPN_f5Ne6T7hY6vFg.text: Its funny, every time I mention that I finally made it over to Moira and that I enjoyed it, I get the same reaction - "really?". For some reason this place has gotten a reputation of being overpriced for the portion sizes and just overall - run of the mill.  We had a different experience entirely, after waiting a couple of mins for a large party to break up, we were sat and then served quickly. The overall aura was one of fun, with a hint of edginess and modern appeal. So this started breaking away from the reputation as well.  The rolls push the envelope for uniqueness and the apps are just plain tasty. If you're in downtown, there's no reason to miss this place, and definitely no reason to travel 20 mins away to some of its competitors. The beer selection is Asian themed, with a chance for me to get a Tiger beer which brought back some memories of my travels across the Pacific.  All in all - fun times and fun food.

ZT9gSyglL342ATwW4vYyKg.text: It's a nicely decorated place unfortunately I made the mistake of choosing this place for a friend's birthday the service and it was terrible for me. My friends all received their food. Halfway through all their meals (drinks, appetizers, rolls, entrees all together) I finally received my one order of rolls. The waitress later came to tell me how it wasn't her fault it was the chefs fault and repeated 3 times that my food was on her way, every time saying "it's no my fault". Once I finally received my roll I was told I'd get a discounted meal. Later she handed out the bulls and said my meal was compensated then came back with a bill and said sorry we're actually only going to discount it and handed me the bill. GRATUITY IS INCLUDED IN THE BILL. I always tip but I don't know how I feel about it snuck into my bill. I did not like it and won't come back nor recommend to anyone.

5DzMLggSOWk3zqM6B1SGrg.text: Tuna is smelly and sold as blue fin but it is cheap Ahi Rice is bad Cooks play with the phone then handle the food Place looks nice but has a smell

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bad ginger, pink stuff is garbage

ceSuwINvpnOxaP0QdBwevQ.text: Absolutely terrible. Ordered to go. Tuna poke was DRENCHED in spicy mayo. I could hardly taste the tuna while I was eating pieces OF TUNA.  The salmon cannolia portion was pathetically petite. The host also managed to be both awkward and rude.  In sum: overpriced bullshit

zV999lBpXvsVL29Iw1qzIw.text: Tried coming here for lunch today and at noon, it was totally dead. Only saw one employee in the whole place, who promptly disappeared after instructing us to sit wherever we wanted. Not a single other customer was there, and there was no sushi chef behind the bar or anything. They also didn't have any lunch specials. Everything was full price. Maybe that's why no customers were there?  While waiting for someone to show up and take our order, we noticed that the paper menu on our table was wrinkled and filthy. Upon further inspection of our table, we realized that the platters and soy sauce bowls in front of all three of us were dirty. I picked up the bowl in front of me and scraped off various different bits of dried on food, and so did my companions.  We got up and walked out. A place that serves raw fish should have very high standards of cleanliness, and Moira appeared to be woefully lacking in that regard. Very disappointing.

gFuIj_2c-_lpTI_o15vLVA.text: I ordered a dish called Roasted Orange there (and the chef must have spilled their sugar can in it!). Anyways on the menu it says $11, and on my check they charged me $14!!!!!! And told me the extra $3 is charged because I didn't add any chicken!!!! So they charge me 3 dollars for extra veggie!!!!!! Seriously?!?! Adding chicken was listed for extra $2 on your menu. Not getting that will be punished for extra $3?!?!?!?! Honestly there's no many vegetables in the dish at all! I will never ever come back to this place ever again! If you have to eat there, due to inevitable reason, I suggest you pay close attention to your check!

bLD3VUaSibmll7qm0gFbHA.text: The best part of my meal was the waitress. Sushi was horrible. Staff in the kitchen could care less about the food they were preparing. Asked to speak to the manager and there was no manager working... Never coming back....seriously.

RRtZLujV2nbNSDBjK31vBg.text: I've been here a number of times and love the location and the ambience. Their happy hour is pretty decent as well and the service is usually pretty good. I'd recommend it!

qrtPoGVU6FJCbXsruGskCg.text: Moira Sushi offers a wonderful happy hour in downtown Phoenix. (It runs until 7pm!) Hot sake is $2 with chilled for $5. The decor is upscale yet you aren't paying ridiculous prices. Service is prompt with orders taken almost immediately and tables are cleared continually.    The edamame is steamed perfectly and salted. I very much enjoyed the kani crunch. (A crab meat concoction with panko generously sprinkled on top.) I was envious when my neighbor called the server over for her spicy yellowtail. I had ordered the same earlier *but* not thought to ask for spicy mayo. (If you want spicy I recommend doing the same.) My version of the spicy yellowtail was just ... yellowtail.  Adorable place well suited for groups. Four tops can readily be combined. I can see this spot being perfect for an intimate date.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy yellowtail! (not actually spicy)
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kani crunch! Yum!

OfdIOKyUAyHF-oUI3-tWRw.text: I deduct one star for the Hispanic sushi chef nodding ike he understood, but didn't. 1 star for average sushi, maybe I should say slightly better than average, cuz there are some awful places out there, but the portions combined with that are an entire star deducted,also I will include that awful non flavorful ponzu. Blah, I jazzed it up with some fresh lemon, and soy. it was very watery.  Now for the Miso soup, Good, and the squid salad generous but not too flavoraful, and the paper napkins are the best I have ever had! (True) but funny right? one star  is kept for these reasons. and the other 2 left stars fare for the good attitude and friendly helpful service of "Kathy" I am not a trendy person not for years, but we wanted sushi, checked Moira out on my phone, and we were just a few miles away. 3 stars are mostly for the service, and the sushi was fresh , but boring and small portions over all a fair 3 stars.  Thank for trying Kathy, but I don't think we will be back

VCUa3nJ9rJt-muvIsd8Rrg.text: I love everything about this place.  The vibe is cool.  The music is good. The food is delicious and I love their late happy hour.  I've eaten here a dozen times and it's still a treat every time I do.

7pH2Ku75vwpXuzN46LZ3NA.text: I wanted something light for my last meal in Phoenix. Sushi was on my mind and this was close to my hotel and near the thriving arts district at Roosevelt Row. The food is fine. They have a food and drink happy hour during the week. The squid salad was a little too soaked in sweet sauce. The Hama Kama was good but again, the sauce it came with was overly sweet. I opted for some ponzu instead. I had orders of salmon and yellow tail belly sashimi. They were both fine but nothing special. The yellow tail belly wasn't good enough to justify the higher price.

d6KGNpo7yyvSdTWsUj5v4Q.text: I'm not one to go the traditional route. I prefer to pick several appetizers and add a few rolls when I am doing a sushi outing. OMG you have to have the Hama Chili, Crackling Calamari, Tuna Poke and Sunshine Roll. I love spice but when you pair it with grapefruit, anyone can take the heat on the Hama Chili. The Crackling Calamari isn't your vanilla appetizer you find elsewhere. Amidst the crispy tentacles, you have a treasure trove of Asian mushrooms, cabbage and crunchy textures that spoil your tastebuds. And if that isn't enough to have you lusting, the Tuna Poke is amaze balls. I love the rice crackers because it's the only way to "permissibly" allow you to scrape the bowl without looking like you lack etiquette. To cleanse your palate of the explosion of happiness erupting in your mouth, the Sunshine Roll is an delish crowd pleaser and closing for your tasting. For someone with a linebacker appetite, I have to admit I was very happily content. Happy belly happy face!!!!  From all the various Buddhas to the chainlink bathroom entrance, I love the setup because it immediately invites you in with the shimmering lights dancing above the bar and the dark decor to be flirtacious. And who can resist a big Asian DJ spinning the best 80s tunes as you down your cold saki to forget the hot days of summer ahead. Definitely making another trip back and will check out happy hour with my entourage. You will not regret it!!! This place oozes sexy and those items are pure seduction.

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunshine Roll cleans your palate while the Crackling Calamari teases you with neutron bombs of flavor.
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hama Chili is perfection of spice and citrus to kick off the night

fuUWZ6F-4J_P3qx-Aq5TDQ.text: I have to say it was a bad experience. I'll boil it down: service was terrible, food is overpriced, quality of the food is definitely far from Japanese, let alone Japanese-American fusion; I probably would've had better service and food at the Pizza Hut down the street.  Here's the full story. My friends and I came here as a last resort on a Friday night. I should've listened to the alarms in my head... The place was pretty empty and the decor screamed "we're attempting to be authentically Asian" by using replicas of the Chinese stone soldiers that were randomly placed around the restaurant. Also to sell that they were a sushi restaurant, they sold only Japanese imported beer (not bad, but it was $9 for a stout I ordered). The hosts (who turned out to be our server and a bartender) just told us to sit anywhere.  We sat down and waited. No server, no water, not even a menu until the bartender/hostess took notice and got us settled. Food was overpriced. I had udon ($8) and it was clearly piss poor. The udon noodles tasted like overcooked ramen noodles. The broth was salty and wasn't anywhere near to actual udon broth; it kind of reminded me of instant ramen. What also surprised me was the vegetables they decided to toss in (who puts broccoli in an Asian soup!?).  Their sushi wasn't worth the price. An order of Unagi nigiri was $6 for two pieces! The size of the Unagi wasn't bad, but I couldn't get the natural flavor of the eel because it was drenched in sauce; obviously this is a sign that the sushi chef is covering up their lack of confidence in what they created.  Obviously at this point we wanted out. It took us a good 15 minutes to flag down our inattentive server for the check. He drops the check and we realized he didn't split it so spent another 10 trying to flag him (or anyone) down. Luckily the bartender, who was more attentive, saw us, cleared out dishes, took our check, and tracked down the server.  I'm sorry to say that this place is really poor. I do like Asian fusion, but this was horrendous and wallet snatching. Normally I'm a believer in second chances, but I think this experience takes the cake. Take my review lightly if you want, but just know what you'll be getting into.

_I1ZdCe2T-tAAvCxJFS18A.text: I'm new to Phoenix and LOVE sushi (planning a trip to Japan just to taste authentic sushi) and Moira did not disappoint. For me, the staple of any sushi restaurant should be the tuna and salmon sushi, and both were awesome! I also tried a few of the rolls that appealed to me which weren't the best that I've ever had but for the price couldn't be beat. If you're looking for a roll and like salmon, I recommend the Sunshine roll! I savored every bite. All in all the happy hour prices were awesome and the service was quick and friendly. I'll definitely be back.

nHG5Kgg77YlqkUgpDklf7w.text: The food is very good here, always a plus since their kitchen is open until 2am! I was waiting in line for the restroom small talking with a lady waiting too, she was extremely kind! I made a note on how I loved the music they were playing, a few minutes after returning, Moira (whom I was small talking with) came to our table and shared her Spotify playlist with me!

-NLPNGoqRIUdqr7WVo0KNw.text: I needed something for my late night munchies and I should have simply passed and went to bed.  I ordered some chicken karaage to go and within a few hours, I was puking in the middle of the night. Thank goodness it was simply one puke fest session and didn't go all night. The chicken itself wasn't crispy at all.  I really think this place is cutting some weird corners when the owner isn't around. That or the owner has relaxed rules.   Case in point. We arrived at about 1020 pm and the door was locked. They were already closing even though the sign says closing at 11 pm. 40 minutes closing early is a bit much.  In addition, when I ordered the karaage, the menu I believe stated 8 bucks and change with tax. I gave 9 bucks and waited for my change, which was about 63 cents or so, no big deal but it's still money. The staff member proceeds to tell me that they ROUND UP and don't carry change. LOL. Is this actually True? So I got charged 9 bucks total. I didn't even fight it at this point.  I think they did this b/c they already counted up their cash registers b/c they were closing early. This is absolute BS.  This place is pure trash.

Sc29lvJu0aGhoMrLgwcHYg.text: This place has great food/drinks, service was awesome and it's beautiful inside and out. Check it out

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So pretty

lcV2X63abbrKG9sdLmtV2A.text: Needed a great sushi fix. Asked around, everyone said "Moira". I'm so glad they did, Wow!   Great service from our amazing server Megan, we sat at the Sushi bar and watched the sushi masters at work. Thank you Michael, Able and Aaron. The Sushi was great! I'm coming back soon...and I live in Gilbert. Great vibe, well deserved 5 Stars.

wVKlancZ3yy-_MsgBChiCg.text: I visited Moira at 10 pm after First Friday. The decor was appealing and the lighting was dark and calm. Once we were seated we were advised of happy hour starting at 1030... which is awesome. I ordered calamari as an appetizer and it was pretty delicious. Once happy hour rolled around, we order 4 rolls - Vegas, Shrimp Tempura, Salmon, and Yellowtail. All to which were very disappointing... very bland. Sushi was room temperature, not hot nor cold. Not much texture and little to no taste. The service was medicore at best.. our server didn't come around much and we asked other servers for condiments. After a while, every server that walked by filled up our water... so at least we were never without water but I saw easily 4 different servers helping us. I don't know if that is the type of service they have or they were helping out... hard to say. But due to not so pleasant taste of this sushi...  I won't be visiting again. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sushi was appealing... taste was bland.

EXafaUGoJvJY3QgUhPBdgQ.text: We started with sirachi garlic edamame, followed with the dragon roll, tiger, and sensi. One word... amazing! Skeptical after reading reviews, but thrilled we tried it. You be the judge!!

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ohDlmQuvAvcdSFSDsG_77g.text: We walked from my layover hotel after my flight landed late to have a late night dinner and drink here... partly because both Yelp and the restaurants website said it was open until 2300. We arrived at 2224 pm on this particular Monday night. The waitress was sitting where we entered smoking a cigarette.. I'm sorry if I sound snobby, it's unprofessional looking to do that where guests are entering to eat. Literally the smell of smoke as we entered Moira was enough, in itself to turn me away. Next.. we entered and the hostess doesn't really greet us, she only says that we have 4 minutes to order food.. MY this place is winning us over! I even pointed out the hours posted on the website and she said we could sit or not ! IF we had not been so hungry ... We would have left; I was ready to skip the meal and take a chance at the loud sports bar up by my hotel. The cooks all glared at us.. she then told us we would get 'faster and better service by sitting at the sushi bar'. TELL me who says that?!! LIKE silly dummies, that's what we did and I grumbled about having to rush my order and sit in an uncomfortable bar stool after flying all day to my husband. Here comes the 'smoking' waitress now. Did she wash her hands? We didn't see her do anything but come strait to us.. yuck! We rush through our order. We had no time to ask questions because one of the chefs was eight in front of us staring and watching the time. The hot dishes we ordered were really tasty : The Crackling Calamari; an Orange Peel dish  ( I can't remember the actual name), that you choose the protein for , we went with chicken ).. I personally didn't love the sushi, although all that we ordered was on reverse happy hour and had good portion size for the price. I found the rolls to be not cold in temp and that alone not only freaked me out.. BUT, the ones I tasted, were tasteless and lacking in actual 'fish'. Btw, the happy hour menu also listed 2300 as closing time.. and we were one of three couples dining in this small place, so that couldn't be it either. The waitress I do believe saw me checking in on my Yelp app and poured our wines generously, she also kept our glasses of water full, as well as brought a huge sushi rice bowl for us that we didn't touch. But, it wasn't hard to figure out why we were 'advised' to sit at the bar.. they didn't want the clean tables messed up. We felt rushed and the whole experience left us with a bad 'taste in our mouths' .. I wanted to call and speak with a manager today mainly about the time of closing and the rude reception. Won't be back. As there are great sushi places with great services in the valley... this isn't one of them.

mv5_ShCap-pGpNh3F0OfMg.text: I have been here previously, the sushi is good and the happy hour pricing is unbeatable!  This experience was horrible. It was not busy the entire time we were there, but yet our food, drinks and even water refills took an unacceptable amount of time.  We had received our  food 40 minutes after ordering and our first round of drinks nearly 10 minutes after that. Our table had asked for Siracha and after waiting 10 minutes and asking a second time, we went directly to the bar to get it.  We had to ask another waitress to refill our water and she apologized for our waitress.   This was an awful experience.

TzM23qpF-XfruzpMPxDsJw.text: I give this place 1 star for many reasons; *30 minute wait turned into a 45 minute wait *they charge $1 for two lemon slices (without telling you they cost extra) *they charge $1 for eel sauce (without telling you it costs extra) *it took 15 minutes just to get our waiter over, and then another 10 minutes to get our water. *they tell their management "oh I definitely warned him about the eel sauce" then the manager comes over with attitude after I say "I swear on my life he never once told us anything cost extra EXCEPT that deep frying a roll will cost more" the manager then responds "I'm not doing this with you rite now" then leaves the tab and walks away. *we were left with almost $15 left of just eel sauce and lemon  I will never eat here again.

dG5Zr-wr0-FOi6BohSey-g.text: Was very excited to try this place and was poorly disappointed in the end. Party of 8. Very slow service. Took 40 minutes to get drinks only to be told they were out of ingredients. Basic sushi rolls took almost an hour. Orders were wrong. The restaurant was less than half way full. Server was not apologetic for the issues.   I would not recommend this place.

q_4v879zn-HoLkjJKRBrow.text: If I could give negative stars, I would.   WORST SERVICE I have ever received. I ordered a cocktail off their drink menu, ask for it 4 times, and 40 minutes later, they informed me they ran out of the ingredients to make it.   Our food took over 50 minutes- and it was served randomly every 10 minutes, so we couldn't even eat together.   Don't eat here. Don't drink here.   This was a JOKE.

dTKTv5-7dy6JDOr2rDXaUQ.text: Sushi was good but was not a fan of the happy hour.... really no sashimi or normal 2 piece sushi on happy hour?! Big let down

A0JS8tNVZN3WSp7XxE3U9w.text: Well, the spot is great! The ambiance is nice, classy, on the quiet side, good for a first date.   The sushi selection is very good, and they have a GREAT Happy Hour; you can literally eat an entire delicious and satisfying sushi dinner off from their Happy Hour menu.   Our waitress was very nice, and the service was fast.  The drinks are a bit on the expensive side, but they are pretty yummy. If you're on a budget, I would definitely just stick to sake bombs.  I will definitely be going back.

RViiKoSI9YJFdcSpozuVLw.text: Very good food and atmosphere.  We have come here twice and had good service both times. It is nice to watch the chefs make your sushi right in front.

C9T8QnV6zA1soa2H8ed1Cg.text: Granted... I walked in Not know when you're supposed to be seated at the bar. No one was there. After being ignored for five minutes with two sushi chefs behind the bar, I asked to whom i should be speaking with. I'm pretty easy-going, however, when asked, "did you check in with the front desk?" with a condescending tone indicating,  I was "wrong." I surmised that The attitude was projecting that I was being punished for not being seated by the hostess. They knew I was there and simply chose to ignore me because I didn't follow their protocol. Good luck with your customer service issues in the future...

Ow92IvsV6S-bOSYaPUCFwA.text: great food amazing happy hour prices. great serves ill diffinately be back when im in phoenix. only thing that sucked, and its probably cause im a big guy, but the stools at the sushi bar are a little small but other then that great place good fish

fBaEr-uqxy7576auxVCuOg.text: The service is great and very nice people. I would definitely come back because the sushi devine!

3MszFKf98JGkbsPHkWBlvQ.text: Really delicious sushi + hot dishes. Among the best sushi I've had in the Valley. Super fresh, great flavors. Also great service, even with a particularly rowdy table near ours causing a lot of ruckus.

09s2VxDMcR0cdD-YgVed7w.text: I've been here a few times, usually during happy hour. I usually have not had much wait as I'll typically sit at the sushi bar. Service is prompt, shortly after you sit, you're presented with menus and cucumber water. Their happy hour is great! There's a large selection of rolls and appetizers for $5, and good drink specials as well. If eating at the sushi bar you can hand your menu directly to the chefs. Rolls come out super quick, and are always a fresh and delicious experience. Most recently we tried the nori puffs, which are similar to a crab puff, but instead of a wonton, it's fried seaweed. So bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Moira Sushi Bar & Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White blossom roll

aU4J54gdcFOlhEhMSDCNFQ.text: A Tuesday night sushi craving reminded me why this place isn't one I frequent often; the hostess/waitress started by asking me if I was "just one" tonight, which is the first sign that a place should be avoided since their staff don't appreciate solo diners.  Upon sitting down at the sushi bar, I noticed the counter had not been properly wiped down from the previous customers, though who knows how long that might have been. I was presented with the menu and checklist of what I'd like to order, though not informed that I should put said checklist on the fish cases when I had decided on what I would like to order. Having been here several times before--though not for several months--maybe I had simply forgotten, though there was no encouragement or direction by the three chefs behind the counter as to what to do, and the server disappeared for several minutes leaving me without guidance as to Moira's protocol.  I should add that I did order a spirit that comes in a bottle, and it was simply dropped off without being opened or poured from me. Maybe this is a breakdown in what I understand as cultural tradition, but servers usually open and pour the drink by my experience. This particular server didn't even bother taking the glass off the bottle.  The food itself was decent in the sense that it sort of scratched my craving for fresh fish, though other than the sashimi I ordered I was really left lacking. The sushi seemed too big for the average person's mouth and the lobster nachos were much too big for being what could have been an otherwise enjoyable bite-size appetizer.  The food also seemed improperly paced; something that could have been the result of it being a very slow night and a kitchen staff eager to do something productive, but it came at the expense of pacing. I ordered what could be considered four courses, yet almost all of them came out on top of each other with no time for one course to breath before the next was presented.  To top it off, the server/hostess dropped the check off before I had even received all of my order, and never bothered to see if I wanted an additional drink or dessert.  Moira has been around for several years, and based on my experience tonight, I'm puzzled as to why, other than that there are enough customers who don't know better or who have never experienced proper service and food and don't realize the subpar experience they are getting, or that they are much better staffed and prepared on other nights of the week. Maybe the neighborhood is strong enough to keep them in business, though as a downtowner I have to think this will be my final time at Moira. The service was lazy, the presentation of the food mediocre, and the food itself decent but poorly executed.  If you are in the mood for quality Japanese food, there are a number of better options than Moira and I highly encourage you to explore the better options throughout the valley.

KUmB1a7CtEjgYqITqQwQNQ.text: Came here to celebrate a birthday with a large group of friends. They accommodated our group no problem. There are lots of great appetizers to choose from and we ordered a bunch. The las vegas rolls were amazing. I wanted another order but since we went all in on the appetizers, they wouldn't fit. Definitely will be back for more!

M7D5dKRPLOfjHkEJwY8OUw.text: Megan was our server and she was great! She gave us great opinions. The white pear sake was amazing. Sense roll, spicy Hana , smoked salmon roll were so good. Cool ambience and really dark. We will for sure be back.
